content.content:
1→version: '3.8'
     2→
     3→# Development configuration with hot reloading
     4→# Usage: docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up
     5→
     6→services:
     7→  # PocketBase - Authentication & Database
     8→  pocketbase:
     9→    image: ghcr.io/muchobien/pocketbase:latest
    10→    container_name: framer-pocketbase-dev
    11→    ports:
    12→      - "8090:8090"
    13→    volumes:
    14→      - pocketbase_data_dev:/pb_data
    15→      - ./pocketbase/pb_migrations:/pb_migrations
    16→    healthcheck:
    17→      test: ["CMD", "wget", "--no-verbose", "--tries=1", "--spider", "http://localhost:8090/api/health"]
    18→      interval: 10s
    19→      timeout: 5s
    20→      retries: 5
    21→
    22→  # FastAPI Backend with hot reload
    23→  backend:
    24→    build:
    25→      context: .
    26→      dockerfile: Dockerfile.backend
    27→    container_name: framer-backend-dev
    28→    ports:
    29→      - "8000:8000"
    30→    environment:
    31→      - POCKETBASE_URL=http://pocketbase:8090
    32→      - DATA_PATH=/data
    33→      - REQUIRE_AUTH=true
    34→    volumes:
    35→      - ./src/backend/app:/app/app:ro
    36→      - backend_data_dev:/data
    37→    command: ["uvicorn", "app.main:get_app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000", "--reload"]
    38→    depends_on:
    39→      pocketbase:
    40→        condition: service_healthy
    41→
    42→  # Next.js Frontend with hot reload
    43→  frontend:
    44→    image: node:20-alpine
    45→    container_name: framer-frontend-dev
    46→    working_dir: /app
    47→    ports:
    48→      - "3000:3000"
    49→    environment:
    50→      - NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000
    51→      - NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://localhost:8090
    52→      - NEXT_PUBLIC_USE_API=true
    53→    volumes:
    54→      - ./prototype:/app
    55→      - /app/node_modules
    56→      - /app/.next
    57→    command: sh -c "npm install && npm run dev"
    58→    depends_on:
    59→      - backend
    60→
    61→volumes:
    62→  pocketbase_data_dev:
    63→  backend_data_dev:
    64→

1→# Framer Backend Dockerfile
     2→FROM python:3.12-slim
     3→
     4→WORKDIR /app
     5→
     6→# Install system dependencies
     7→RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
     8→    git \
     9→    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    10→
    11→# Copy requirements and install Python dependencies
    12→COPY src/backend/requirements.txt .
    13→RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt
    14→
    15→# Copy backend source code
    16→COPY src/backend/app ./app
    17→
    18→# Create data directories
    19→RUN mkdir -p /data/frames /data/templates /data/conversations /data/knowledge /data/vector_db
    20→
    21→# Expose port
    22→EXPOSE 8000
    23→
    24→# Run the application
    25→CMD ["uvicorn", "app.main:get_app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000"]

content.content:
1→# Framer Frontend Dockerfile
     2→FROM node:20-alpine AS base
     3→
     4→# Install dependencies only when needed
     5→FROM base AS deps
     6→RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat
     7→WORKDIR /app
     8→
     9→# Copy package files from production frontend
    10→COPY src/frontend/package.json src/frontend/package-lock.json* ./
    11→RUN npm ci
    12→
    13→# Rebuild the source code only when needed
    14→FROM base AS builder
    15→WORKDIR /app
    16→COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
    17→COPY src/frontend/ .
    18→
    19→# Set build-time environment variables
    20→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000
    21→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://localhost:8090
    22→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL
    23→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL
    24→
    25→# Build the application
    26→RUN npm run build
    27→
    28→# Production image, copy all the files and run next
    29→FROM base AS runner
    30→WORKDIR /app
    31→
    32→ENV NODE_ENV=production
    33→
    34→RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs
    35→RUN adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs
    36→
    37→# Copy built assets
    38→COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
    39→COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
    40→COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static
    41→
    42→USER nextjs
    43→
    44→EXPOSE 3000
    45→
    46→ENV PORT=3000
    47→ENV HOSTNAME="0.0.0.0"
    48→
    49→CMD ["node", "server.js"]
    50→

content.content:
1→[project]
     2→name = "framer-backend"
     3→version = "0.1.0"
     4→description = "Framer - AI-assisted pre-development thinking framework"
     5→requires-python = ">=3.11"
     6→dependencies = [
     7→    "fastapi>=0.109.0",
     8→    "uvicorn[standard]>=0.27.0",
     9→    "pydantic>=2.5.0",
    10→    "pydantic-settings>=2.1.0",
    11→    "gitpython>=3.1.40",
    12→    "aiosqlite>=0.19.0",
    13→    "pyyaml>=6.0.1",
    14→    "markdown-it-py>=3.0.0",
    15→    "httpx>=0.26.0",
    16→    "python-multipart>=0.0.6",
    17→]
    18→
    19→[project.optional-dependencies]
    20→dev = [
    21→    "pytest>=7.4.0",
    22→    "pytest-asyncio>=0.23.0",
    23→    "pytest-cov>=4.1.0",
    24→    "httpx>=0.26.0",
    25→]
    26→ai = [
    27→    "agno>=0.1.0",
    28→    "openai>=1.10.0",
    29→    "anthropic>=0.18.0",
    30→]
    31→vector = [
    32→    "chromadb>=0.4.0",
    33→]
    34→
    35→[build-system]
    36→requires = ["hatchling"]
    37→build-backend = "hatchling.build"
    38→
    39→[tool.pytest.ini_options]
    40→asyncio_mode = "auto"
    41→testpaths = ["../../tests/backend"]
    42→python_files = ["test_*.py"]
    43→python_functions = ["test_*"]
    44→addopts = "-v --tb=short"
    45→
    46→[tool.coverage.run]
    47→source = ["app"]
    48→omit = ["*/tests/*"]
    49→
    50→[tool.coverage.report]
    51→exclude_lines = [
    52→    "pragma: no cover",
    53→    "if TYPE_CHECKING:",
    54→    "raise NotImplementedError",
    55→]
    56→

content.content:
1→# Framer
     2→
     3→**AI-Assisted Pre-Development Thinking Framework**
     4→
     5→Framer is a structured thinking tool that helps engineering teams frame problems before writing code. It combines a conversation-first workflow with AI coaching to ensure thorough problem understanding, user perspective consideration, and validation planning.
     6→
     7→![Dashboard - Kanban Board](docs/screenshots/02-dashboard.png)
     8→
     9→## Why Framer?
    10→
    11→Before jumping into code, developers often miss crucial context:
    12→- **Who** is affected by this problem?
    13→- **What** are we explicitly *not* doing?
    14→- **How** will we know if we succeeded?
    15→
    16→Framer provides a structured framework to capture this thinking through natural conversation with an AI coach, then synthesizes it into a well-organized frame document.
    17→
    18→## Key Features
    19→
    20→### Conversation-First Frame Creation
    21→
    22→Start by describing your problem in plain language. The AI Coach guides you through structured thinking, tracking discussion coverage across four key dimensions in real time.
    23→
    24→![Conversation Interface](docs/screenshots/05-conversation.png)
    25→
    26→The right sidebar shows **Discussion Coverage** — how much of each section has been explored — along with identified gaps. When ready, preview the synthesized frame before committing.
    27→
    28→### Structured Frame Documents
    29→
    30→Each frame captures four dimensions of pre-development thinking:
    31→
    32→| Section | Purpose |
    33→|---------|---------|
    34→| **Problem Statement** | Clear, focused description of what needs solving |
    35→| **User Perspective** | Who experiences this, their journey, and pain points |
    36→| **Engineering Framing** | Technical principles, trade-offs, and explicit non-goals |
    37→| **Validation Thinking** | Success signals and disconfirming evidence |
    38→
    39→![Frame Detail View](docs/screenshots/03-frame-detail.png)
    40→
    41→### AI-Powered Quality Assessment
    42→
    43→Frames are automatically evaluated by AI for completeness and quality. The evaluation provides a score breakdown per section, written feedback, and specific issues to address.
    44→
    45→![AI Evaluation & Version History](docs/screenshots/04-ai-evaluation.png)
    46→
    47→### Kanban Workflow
    48→
    49→Visual status tracking with drag-and-drop across stages:
    50→
    51→**Draft** → **In Review** → **Ready** → **Feedback** → **Archived**
    52→
    53→Filter by frame type (Feature, Bug, Exploration) or owner. Each card shows the AI quality score at a glance.
    54→
    55→### Knowledge Base
    56→
    57→A team-wide knowledge system for patterns, decisions, and lessons learned. Supports semantic search via vector embeddings and manual categorization.
    58→
    59→![Knowledge Base](docs/screenshots/06-knowledge.png)
    60→
    61→Categories: **Pattern** | **Decision** | **Prediction** | **Context** | **Lesson**
    62→
    63→### Frame Preview
    64→
    65→Preview what a synthesized frame will look like before committing. If no new messages have been sent since the last preview, the cached content is reused — no redundant AI calls.
    66→
    67→### Version History
    68→
    69→Git-backed change tracking with full diff support. Every synthesis and edit creates a commit, so you can trace how a frame evolved over time.
    70→
    71→### Admin Portal
    72→
    73→Separate admin interface for system configuration, user management, and AI provider settings.
    74→
    75→![Admin Portal](docs/screenshots/07-admin-login.png)
    76→
    77→## Architecture
    78→
    79→```
    80→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
    81→│                    Frontend (Next.js)                        │
    82→│  React 19 + Zustand + Tailwind CSS v4 + Radix UI           │
    83→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    84→│                    Backend (FastAPI)                         │
    85→│  REST API + AI Agents + File Storage + ChromaDB Vectors     │
    86→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    87→│                   PocketBase (Auth)                          │
    88→│  User Authentication + Session Management                   │
    89→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
    90→```
    91→
    92→### Backend Services
    93→- **FrameService**: CRUD operations with file-based storage (YAML/JSON/Markdown)
    94→- **ConversationService**: Conversation history and state management
    95→- **KnowledgeService**: Knowledge entry persistence and retrieval
    96→- **VectorService**: Semantic search via ChromaDB (default: all-MiniLM-L6-v2 embeddings)
    97→- **GitService**: Automatic version control with diff support
    98→- **IndexService**: SQLite cache for fast queries
    99→
   100→### AI Agents
   101→- **ConversationAgent**: Guides users through structured problem framing via chat
   102→- **EvaluatorAgent**: Scores frames and provides detailed quality feedback
   103→- **GeneratorAgent**: Creates content from questionnaire answers
   104→- **RefinerAgent**: Improves content through conversation
   105→
   106→AI providers are configurable — supports **Anthropic**, **OpenAI**, and any **OpenAI-compatible** endpoint (MiniMax, GLM, local models, etc.).
   107→
   108→## Getting Started
   109→
   110→### Prerequisites
   111→- Docker & Docker Compose (recommended)
   112→- Or: Python 3.12+ and Node.js 20+
   113→
   114→### Quick Start with Docker
   115→
   116→```bash
   117→# Clone the repository
   118→git clone https://github.com/ethannortharc/framer.git
   119→cd framer
   120→
   121→# Start all services
   122→docker compose up -d
   123→
   124→# Or use the helper script for specific environments
   125→./scripts/docker.sh dev up      # Development
   126→./scripts/docker.sh qa up       # QA/Staging
   127→./scripts/docker.sh prod up     # Production
   128→```
   129→
   130→Services:
   131→- Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   132→- Backend API: http://localhost:8000
   133→- PocketBase Admin: http://localhost:8090/_/
   134→
   135→### Local Development
   136→
   137→```bash
   138→# Install dependencies
   139→make install
   140→
   141→# Start development servers
   142→make dev
   143→```
   144→
   145→Or start each service individually:
   146→
   147→```bash
   148→# Terminal 1: Backend
   149→cd src/backend
   150→uvicorn app.main:get_app --reload --port 8000
   151→
   152→# Terminal 2: Frontend
   153→cd src/frontend
   154→npm run dev
   155→```
   156→
   157→## Configuration
   158→
   159→### Environment Variables
   160→
   161→Configuration files are stored in `config/` directory:
   162→- `.env.common` — Shared settings across all environments
   163→- `.env.dev` — Development (ports 3000, 8000, 8090)
   164→- `.env.qa` — QA/Staging (ports 3001, 8001, 8091)
   165→- `.env.prod` — Production (ports 80, 8000, 8090)
   166→
   167→### AI Configuration
   168→
   169→```env
   170→AI_PROVIDER=anthropic          # anthropic | openai | minimax | glm
   171→AI_API_KEY=your-api-key
   172→REDACTED
   173→AI_TEMPERATURE=0.7
   174→AI_MAX_TOKENS=4096
   175→AI_TIMEOUT=300
   176→```
   177→
   178→### Embedding Configuration
   179→
   180→```env
   181→EMBEDDING_PROVIDER=default     # default (all-MiniLM-L6-v2) | openai (text-embedding-3-small)
   182→```
   183→
   184→## Project Structure
   185→
   186→```
   187→framer/
   188→├── src/
   189→│   ├── backend/              # FastAPI backend
   190→│   │   └── app/
   191→│   │       ├── api/          # REST endpoints (frames, conversations, knowledge, ai, admin)
   192→│   │       ├── agents/       # AI agents (conversation, evaluator, generator, refiner)
   193→│   │       ├── auth/         # PocketBase authentication
   194→│   │       ├── models/       # Pydantic data models
   195→│   │       └── services/     # Business logic (frame, conversation, knowledge, git, vector)
   196→│   │
   197→│   └── frontend/             # Next.js frontend
   198→│       └── src/
   199→│           ├── app/          # App router (dashboard, new, frame/[id], knowledge, admin, archive)
   200→│           ├── components/   # React components (ui, layout, dashboard, frame, conversation)
   201→│           ├── contexts/     # React contexts (AuthContext)
   202→│           ├── lib/          # API client, auth, transforms
   203→│           ├── store/        # Zustand state management
   204→│           └── types/        # TypeScript types
   205→│
   206→├── config/                   # Environment configuration (.env.dev, .env.qa, .env.prod)
   207→├── data/templates/           # Frame templates (bug-fix, feature, exploration)
   208→├── docs/screenshots/         # Application screenshots
   209→├── pocketbase/               # PocketBase migrations
   210→├── scripts/                  # Helper scripts (docker.sh)
   211→├── tests/                    # Backend tests (pytest)
   212→├── docker-compose.yml
   213→└── Makefile
   214→```
   215→
   216→## API Reference
   217→
   218→### Frames API
   219→
   220→| Method | Endpoint | Description |
   221→|--------|----------|-------------|
   222→| GET | `/api/frames` | List frames (filterable by status, owner, project) |
   223→| POST | `/api/frames` | Create a frame |
   224→| GET | `/api/frames/{id}` | Get frame by ID |
   225→| PUT | `/api/frames/{id}` | Update frame content |
   226→| PATCH | `/api/frames/{id}/status` | Update frame status |
   227→| DELETE | `/api/frames/{id}` | Delete a frame |
   228→| GET | `/api/frames/{id}/history` | Get version history with diffs |
   229→| POST | `/api/frames/{id}/ai/evaluate` | AI quality evaluation |
   230→
   231→### Conversations API
   232→
   233→| Method | Endpoint | Description |
   234→|--------|----------|-------------|
   235→| POST | `/api/conversations` | Start a new conversation |
   236→| GET | `/api/conversations` | List conversations |
   237→| GET | `/api/conversations/{id}` | Get conversation by ID |
   238→| POST | `/api/conversations/{id}/message` | Send a message |
   239→| POST | `/api/conversations/{id}/preview` | Preview synthesized frame (no persist) |
   240→| POST | `/api/conversations/{id}/synthesize` | Synthesize and create/update frame |
   241→| DELETE | `/api/conversations/{id}` | Delete a conversation |
   242→
   243→### Knowledge API
   244→
   245→| Method | Endpoint | Description |
   246→|--------|----------|-------------|
   247→| POST | `/api/knowledge` | Create a knowledge entry |
   248→| GET | `/api/knowledge` | List entries (filterable) |
   249→| POST | `/api/knowledge/search` | Semantic vector search |
   250→| POST | `/api/knowledge/distill` | AI-extract knowledge from conversations |
   251→
   252→### AI API
   253→
   254→| Method | Endpoint | Description |
   255→|--------|----------|-------------|
   256→| POST | `/api/ai/evaluate` | Evaluate frame quality |
   257→| POST | `/api/ai/generate` | Generate content from answers |
   258→| POST | `/api/ai/chat` | Chat for content refinement |
   259→
   260→## Testing
   261→
   262→```bash
   263→# Run all backend tests
   264→make test-backend
   265→
   266→# Or directly
   267→python -m pytest tests/backend/ -v
   268→
   269→# E2E tests (Playwright)
   270→cd src/frontend && npm run test:e2e
   271→```
   272→
   273→## Tech Stack
   274→
   275→**Frontend**: Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript, Zustand, Tailwind CSS v4, Radix UI, Playwright
   276→
   277→**Backend**: Python 3.12, FastAPI, Pydantic v2, GitPython, ChromaDB, SQLite
   278→
   279→**Infrastructure**: Docker & Docker Compose, PocketBase (auth)
   280→
   281→**AI**: Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT, or any OpenAI-compatible provider
   282→
   283→## License
   284→
   285→MIT
   286→
   287→## Contributing
   288→
   289→1. Fork the repository
   290→2. Create a feature branch
   291→3. Make your changes with tests
   292→4. Run `make test` to verify
   293→5. Submit a pull request
   294→
   295→---
   296→
   297→Built with the belief that better thinking leads to better code.
   298→

content.content:
1→# Development Environment Configuration
     2→
     3→# ============================================
     4→# Ports (exposed to host)
     5→# ============================================
     6→POCKETBASE_PORT=8090
     7→BACKEND_PORT=8000
     8→FRONTEND_PORT=3000
     9→
    10→# ============================================
    11→# Service URLs (for inter-service communication)
    12→# ============================================
    13→# Internal URLs (within Docker network)
    14→POCKETBASE_INTERNAL_URL=http://pocketbase:8090
    15→BACKEND_INTERNAL_URL=http://backend:8000
    16→
    17→# External URLs (from browser/client)
    18→POCKETBASE_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:8090
    19→BACKEND_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:8000
    20→FRONTEND_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:3000
    21→
    22→# ============================================
    23→# Frontend Configuration
    24→# ============================================
    25→NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000
    26→NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://localhost:8090
    27→NEXT_PUBLIC_API_TIMEOUT=30000
    28→
    29→# ============================================
    30→# Backend Configuration
    31→# ============================================
    32→BACKEND_DATA_PATH=/data
    33→BACKEND_LOG_LEVEL=debug
    34→BACKEND_CORS_ORIGINS=http://localhost:3000,http://127.0.0.1:3000
    35→
    36→# ============================================
    37→# PocketBase Configuration
    38→# ============================================
    39→POCKETBASE_ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com
    40→# POCKETBASE_ADMIN_PASSWORD should be set securely, not in version control
    41→
    42→# ============================================
    43→# Volume Paths (optional local mounts for development)

content.content:
1→# Configuration Guide
     2→
     3→This directory contains environment-specific configuration files for the Framer application.
     4→
     5→## Directory Structure
     6→
     7→```
     8→config/
     9→├── .env.common     # Shared settings across all environments
    10→├── .env.dev        # Development environment
    11→├── .env.qa         # QA/Staging environment
    12→├── .env.prod       # Production environment
    13→└── README.md       # This file
    14→```
    15→
    16→## Usage
    17→
    18→### Quick Start (Development)
    19→
    20→```bash
    21→# From project root
    22→docker-compose --env-file config/.env.dev up -d
    23→```
    24→
    25→### Using Different Environments
    26→
    27→```bash
    28→# Development
    29→docker-compose --env-file config/.env.dev up -d
    30→
    31→# QA/Staging
    32→docker-compose --env-file config/.env.qa up -d
    33→
    34→# Production
    35→docker-compose --env-file config/.env.prod up -d
    36→```
    37→
    38→### Using the Helper Script
    39→
    40→```bash
    41→# Start services
    42→./scripts/docker.sh dev up
    43→
    44→# Stop services
    45→./scripts/docker.sh dev down
    46→
    47→# View logs
    48→./scripts/docker.sh dev logs
    49→
    50→# Rebuild and start
    51→./scripts/docker.sh dev up --build
    52→```
    53→
    54→## Configuration Variables
    55→
    56→### Ports
    57→
    58→| Variable | Default | Description |
    59→|----------|---------|-------------|
    60→| `POCKETBASE_PORT` | 8090 | PocketBase external port |
    61→| `BACKEND_PORT` | 8000 | FastAPI backend external port |
    62→| `FRONTEND_PORT` | 3000 | Next.js frontend external port |
    63→
    64→### Service URLs
    65→
    66→| Variable | Description |
    67→|----------|-------------|
    68→| `POCKETBASE_INTERNAL_URL` | URL for services to reach PocketBase (within Docker network) |
    69→| `BACKEND_INTERNAL_URL` | URL for services to reach backend (within Docker network) |
    70→| `POCKETBASE_EXTERNAL_URL` | URL for clients to reach PocketBase |
    71→| `BACKEND_EXTERNAL_URL` | URL for clients to reach backend |
    72→| `FRONTEND_EXTERNAL_URL` | URL for clients to reach frontend |
    73→
    74→### Frontend Configuration
    75→
    76→| Variable | Default | Description |
    77→|----------|---------|-------------|
    78→| `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL` | http://localhost:8000 | API URL for frontend |
    79→| `NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL` | http://localhost:8090 | PocketBase URL for frontend |
    80→| `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_TIMEOUT` | 30000 | API request timeout (ms) |
    81→
    82→### Backend Configuration
    83→
    84→| Variable | Default | Description |
    85→|----------|---------|-------------|
    86→| `BACKEND_DATA_PATH` | /data | Data storage path in container |
    87→| `BACKEND_LOG_LEVEL` | info | Logging level (debug/info/warning/error) |
    88→| `BACKEND_CORS_ORIGINS` | http://localhost:3000 | Allowed CORS origins (comma-separated) |
    89→
    90→### Container Settings
    91→
    92→| Variable | Default | Description |
    93→|----------|---------|-------------|
    94→| `COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME` | framer | Docker Compose project name |
    95→| `RESTART_POLICY` | unless-stopped | Container restart policy |
    96→| `HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL` | 10s | Health check interval |
    97→| `HEALTHCHECK_TIMEOUT` | 5s | Health check timeout |
    98→| `HEALTHCHECK_RETRIES` | 5 | Health check retry count |
    99→
   100→## Creating a New Environment
   101→
   102→1. Copy an existing environment file:
   103→   ```bash
   104→   cp config/.env.dev config/.env.staging
   105→   ```
   106→
   107→2. Update the values for your environment
   108→
   109→3. Use it with Docker Compose:
   110→   ```bash
   111→   docker-compose --env-file config/.env.staging up -d
   112→   ```
   113→
   114→## Security Notes
   115→
   116→- **Never commit sensitive values** (passwords, API keys) to version control
   117→- Use environment variables or secrets management for production
   118→- The `.env.prod` file should only contain non-sensitive defaults
   119→- Consider using Docker secrets or external secrets management (Vault, AWS Secrets Manager)
   120→
   121→## Local Development Override
   122→
   123→For local customization without modifying tracked files:
   124→
   125→1. Create a local override file:
   126→   ```bash
   127→   cp config/.env.dev config/.env.local
   128→   ```
   129→
   130→2. Add `config/.env.local` to `.gitignore`
   131→
   132→3. Use it:
   133→   ```bash
   134→   docker-compose --env-file config/.env.local up -d
   135→   ```
   136→

content.content:
1→# Framer Project Makefile
     2→# Common commands for development and deployment
     3→
     4→.PHONY: help install dev test test-backend test-e2e build docker-build docker-up docker-down clean
     5→
     6→# Default target
     7→help:
     8→	@echo "Framer Project Commands"
     9→	@echo ""
    10→	@echo "Development:"
    11→	@echo "  make install      - Install all dependencies"
    12→	@echo "  make dev          - Start development servers (backend + frontend)"
    13→	@echo "  make dev-backend  - Start backend server only"
    14→	@echo "  make dev-frontend - Start frontend server only"
    15→	@echo ""
    16→	@echo "Testing:"
    17→	@echo "  make test         - Run all tests"
    18→	@echo "  make test-backend - Run backend tests only"
    19→	@echo "  make test-e2e     - Run E2E tests"
    20→	@echo "  make test-e2e-ui  - Run E2E tests with UI"
    21→	@echo ""
    22→	@echo "Building:"
    23→	@echo "  make build        - Build frontend for production"
    24→	@echo ""
    25→	@echo "Docker:"
    26→	@echo "  make docker-build - Build Docker images"
    27→	@echo "  make docker-up    - Start all services"
    28→	@echo "  make docker-down  - Stop all services"
    29→	@echo "  make docker-dev   - Start development environment"
    30→	@echo ""
    31→	@echo "Cleanup:"
    32→	@echo "  make clean        - Remove build artifacts"
    33→
    34→# Install dependencies
    35→install:
    36→	@echo "Installing backend dependencies..."
    37→	cd src/backend && pip install -r requirements.txt
    38→	@echo "Installing frontend dependencies..."
    39→	cd prototype && npm install
    40→	@echo "Installing Playwright browsers..."
    41→	cd prototype && npx playwright install
    42→
    43→# Development
    44→dev: dev-backend dev-frontend
    45→
    46→dev-backend:
    47→	@echo "Starting backend server..."
    48→	cd src/backend && uvicorn app.main:get_app --reload --port 8000
    49→
    50→dev-frontend:
    51→	@echo "Starting frontend server..."
    52→	cd prototype && npm run dev
    53→
    54→# Testing
    55→test: test-backend test-e2e
    56→
    57→test-backend:
    58→	@echo "Running backend tests..."
    59→	python -m pytest tests/backend/ -v
    60→
    61→test-e2e:
    62→	@echo "Running E2E tests..."
    63→	cd prototype && npm run test:e2e
    64→
    65→test-e2e-ui:
    66→	@echo "Running E2E tests with UI..."
    67→	cd prototype && npm run test:e2e:ui
    68→
    69→# Building
    70→build:
    71→	@echo "Building frontend..."
    72→	cd prototype && npm run build
    73→
    74→# Docker commands
    75→docker-build:
    76→	@echo "Building Docker images..."
    77→	docker-compose build
    78→
    79→docker-up:
    80→	@echo "Starting all services..."
    81→	docker-compose up -d
    82→	@echo ""
    83→	@echo "Services started:"
    84→	@echo "  Frontend: http://localhost:3000"
    85→	@echo "  Backend:  http://localhost:8000"
    86→	@echo "  PocketBase: http://localhost:8090/_/"
    87→
    88→docker-down:
    89→	@echo "Stopping all services..."
    90→	docker-compose down
    91→
    92→docker-dev:
    93→	@echo "Starting development environment..."
    94→	docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up
    95→
    96→docker-logs:
    97→	docker-compose logs -f
    98→
    99→# Cleanup
   100→clean:
   101→	@echo "Cleaning build artifacts..."
   102→	rm -rf prototype/.next
   103→	rm -rf prototype/node_modules/.cache
   104→	rm -rf __pycache__
   105→	find . -type d -name "__pycache__" -exec rm -rf {} + 2>/dev/null || true
   106→	find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete 2>/dev/null || true
   107→	@echo "Clean complete"
   108→

content.content:
1→#!/bin/bash
     2→# Docker Compose helper script for managing different environments
     3→#
     4→# Usage:
     5→#   ./scripts/docker.sh <env> <command> [options]
     6→#
     7→# Environments:
     8→#   dev     - Development environment
     9→#   qa      - QA/Staging environment
    10→#   prod    - Production environment
    11→#   local   - Local override (if config/.env.local exists)
    12→#
    13→# Commands:
    14→#   up      - Start services (add --build to rebuild)
    15→#   down    - Stop services
    16→#   restart - Restart services
    17→#   logs    - View logs (add -f to follow)
    18→#   ps      - List running containers
    19→#   build   - Build images
    20→#   pull    - Pull latest images
    21→#   exec    - Execute command in container
    22→#   shell   - Open shell in container
    23→#
    24→# Examples:
    25→#   ./scripts/docker.sh dev up
    26→#   ./scripts/docker.sh dev up --build
    27→#   ./scripts/docker.sh prod down
    28→#   ./scripts/docker.sh dev logs -f
    29→#   ./scripts/docker.sh dev shell backend
    30→#   ./scripts/docker.sh dev exec backend python -c "print('hello')"
    31→
    32→set -e
    33→
    34→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    35→PROJECT_ROOT="$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")"
    36→CONFIG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/config"
    37→
    38→# Colors for output
    39→RED='\033[0;31m'
    40→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    41→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    42→NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    43→
    44→# Print colored message
    45→info() { echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"; }
    46→warn() { echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"; }
    47→error() { echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"; exit 1; }
    48→
    49→# Show usage
    50→usage() {
    51→    echo "Usage: $0 <env> <command> [options]"
    52→    echo ""
    53→    echo "Environments: dev, qa, prod, local"
    54→    echo "Commands: up, down, restart, logs, ps, build, pull, exec, shell"
    55→    echo ""
    56→    echo "Examples:"
    57→    echo "  $0 dev up           # Start development environment"
    58→    echo "  $0 dev up --build   # Rebuild and start"
    59→    echo "  $0 prod down        # Stop production"
    60→    echo "  $0 dev logs -f      # Follow logs"
    61→    echo "  $0 dev shell backend # Open shell in backend container"
    62→    exit 1
    63→}
    64→
    65→# Validate environment
    66→validate_env() {
    67→    local env=$1
    68→    case $env in
    69→        dev|qa|prod|local)
    70→            ENV_FILE="$CONFIG_DIR/.env.$env"
    71→            if [[ ! -f "$ENV_FILE" ]]; then
    72→                error "Environment file not found: $ENV_FILE"
    73→            fi
    74→            ;;
    75→        *)
    76→            error "Invalid environment: $env. Use: dev, qa, prod, or local"
    77→            ;;
    78→    esac
    79→}
    80→
    81→# Main execution
    82→main() {
    83→    if [[ $# -lt 2 ]]; then
    84→        usage
    85→    fi
    86→
    87→    local env=$1
    88→    local command=$2
    89→    shift 2
    90→
    91→    validate_env "$env"
    92→
    93→    info "Using environment: $env ($ENV_FILE)"
    94→
    95→    cd "$PROJECT_ROOT"
    96→
    97→    case $command in
    98→        up)
    99→            info "Starting services..."
   100→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" up -d "$@"
   101→            info "Services started. Use '$0 $env logs -f' to view logs."
   102→            ;;
   103→        down)
   104→            info "Stopping services..."
   105→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" down "$@"
   106→            info "Services stopped."
   107→            ;;
   108→        restart)
   109→            info "Restarting services..."
   110→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" restart "$@"
   111→            info "Services restarted."
   112→            ;;
   113→        logs)
   114→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" logs "$@"
   115→            ;;
   116→        ps)
   117→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" ps "$@"
   118→            ;;
   119→        build)
   120→            info "Building images..."
   121→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" build "$@"
   122→            info "Build complete."
   123→            ;;
   124→        pull)
   125→            info "Pulling latest images..."
   126→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" pull "$@"
   127→            info "Pull complete."
   128→            ;;
   129→        exec)
   130→            if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   131→                error "exec requires a service name and command"
   132→            fi
   133→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" exec "$@"
   134→            ;;
   135→        shell)
   136→            if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   137→                error "shell requires a service name"
   138→            fi
   139→            local service=$1
   140→            info "Opening shell in $service..."
   141→            docker-compose --env-file "$ENV_FILE" exec "$service" /bin/sh -c "command -v bash >/dev/null && exec bash || exec sh"
   142→            ;;
   143→        *)
   144→            error "Unknown command: $command"
   145→            ;;
   146→    esac
   147→}
   148→
   149→main "$@"
   150→

content.text:
Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the project. Let me create a detailed summary report.

## Framer Project: Complete Architecture & Configuration Overview

### 1. PROJECT STRUCTURE

**Git Remote URL**: `https://github.com/ethannortharc/framer.git`

The project follows a monorepo structure with organized separation of concerns:

```
framer/
├── src/
│   ├── backend/                    # FastAPI application
│   │   ├── app/
│   │   │   ├── api/               # REST API endpoints (frames, conversations, knowledge, ai, admin)
│   │   │   ├── agents/            # AI agents (conversation, evaluator, generator, refiner)
│   │   │   ├── auth/              # PocketBase authentication
│   │   │   ├── models/            # Pydantic data models with YAML serialization
│   │   │   ├── services/          # Business logic (frame, conversation, knowledge, git, vector)
│   │   │   ├── config/            # Backend configuration
│   │   │   └── main.py            # FastAPI application factory
│   │   ├── requirements.txt        # Python dependencies
│   │   └── pyproject.toml          # Project metadata & optional dependencies
│   │
│   └── frontend/                   # Next.js 16 application
│       ├── src/
│       │   ├── app/               # App Router (dashboard, new, frame/[id], knowledge, admin, archive)
│       │   ├── components/        # React components (ui, layout, dashboard, frame, conversation)
│       │   ├── contexts/          # React contexts (AuthContext)
│       │   ├── lib/               # API client singleton, auth utilities, snake_case↔camelCase transforms
│       │   ├── store/             # Zustand state management
│       │   └── types/             # TypeScript types
│       └── package.json           # Node.js dependencies
│
├── prototype/                      # Alternative frontend build (used in Makefile)
│   ├── src/                        # Next.js app
│   ├── package.json
│   └── tests/                      # Playwright E2E tests
│
├── config/                         # Environment-specific configurations
│   ├── .env.common                 # Shared settings (container names, images, health checks)
│   ├── .env.dev                    # Development (localhost:3000, 8000, 8090)
│   ├── .env.qa                     # QA/Staging (qa subdomains)
│   ├── .env.prod                   # Production (example.com domains)
│   ├── ai.yaml                     # AI provider configuration (mounted in Docker)
│   └── README.md                   # Configuration documentation
│
├── data/templates/                 # Frame templates (bug-fix, feature, exploration)
├── pocketbase/pb_migrations/       # PocketBase migration files
├── scripts/docker.sh               # Docker Compose helper script
├── tests/backend/                  # Backend pytest tests
├── docs/screenshots/               # Application screenshots & design docs
│
├── docker-compose.yml              # Production/default configuration
├── docker-compose.dev.yml          # Development with hot-reload
├── Dockerfile.backend              # Python 3.12 multi-stage build
├── Dockerfile.frontend             # Node.js 20 multi-stage build
├── .dockerignore                   # Docker build exclusions
├── Makefile                        # Local development commands
├── README.md                        # Main documentation
└── .gitignore                      # Git exclusions
```

**Additional directories** (Go/Rust utilities, experimental):
- `cmd/` — Command-line tools (hx, hx-controller, hx-proxy, hx-agent)
- `pkg/` — Go packages (agent, cli, components, controller, core, protocol, sandbox, transport)
- `internal/` — Internal proxy adapters
- `holonex/` — Build infrastructure scaffolding
- `images/` — Docker image configurations (base, claude-code, codex)

---

### 2. DOCKER CONFIGURATION

#### **docker-compose.yml** (Production/Default)
Three services orchestrated with health checks and inter-service dependencies:

| Service | Image | Port | Dependencies | Purpose |
|---------|-------|------|--------------|---------|
| **pocketbase** | `ghcr.io/muchobien/pocketbase:latest` | 8090 | None | Authentication & database (migrations in `/pb_migrations`) |
| **backend** | Built from `Dockerfile.backend` | 8000 | pocketbase (healthy) | FastAPI REST API |
| **frontend** | Built from `Dockerfile.frontend` | 3000 | backend | Next.js SSR application |

- **Health checks**: All services have health checks with 10s interval, 5s timeout, 5 retries
- **Volumes**: Named volumes for `pocketbase_data` and `backend_data` persistence
- **Environment**: Loaded from `config/.env.dev`, `config/.env.qa`, or `config/.env.prod`

#### **docker-compose.dev.yml** (Development Hot-Reload)
Same three services but with:
- Mounted source code for live reloading
- Direct npm/uvicorn commands instead of Dockerfile entry points
- Separate dev-suffixed volume names

#### **Dockerfile.backend** (Python 3.12-slim)
- Base: `python:3.12-slim`
- Installs: git system dependency
- Copies: `src/backend/requirements.txt` → pip install
- Copies: `src/backend/app/` → `/app/app`
- Creates: Data directories for frames, templates, conversations, knowledge, vector_db
- Exposes: Port 8000
- CMD: `uvicorn app.main:get_app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000`

#### **Dockerfile.frontend** (Node.js 20-alpine, Multi-stage)
- **Stage 1 (deps)**: Install dependencies from `src/frontend/package.json`
- **Stage 2 (builder)**: Build Next.js with environment variables:
  - `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL` (default: `http://localhost:8000`)
  - `NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL` (default: `http://localhost:8090`)
- **Stage 3 (runner)**: Production image with non-root user `nextjs:nodejs`
- Exposes: Port 3000
- CMD: `node server.js` (Next.js standalone output)

---

### 3. DEPENDENCIES

#### **Frontend (Node.js 20+)**
**File**: `/home/hongbozhou/projects/poc/framer/src/frontend/package.json`

**Key Dependencies**:
- **Next.js 16.1.6** — React framework with App Router
- **React 19.2.3 + React DOM 19.2.3** — UI library
- **Zustand 5.0.10** — State management
- **Tailwind CSS 4** — Utility-first styling
- **@tailwindcss/typography 0.5.19** — Prose plugin
- **@radix-ui** — Accessible UI components (checkbox, dialog, dropdown, select, tabs, tooltip)
- **lucide-react 0.563.0** — Icon library
- **class-variance-authority 0.7.1** — Component variants
- **clsx 2.1.1** — Utility for className merging
- **react-markdown 10.1.0** — Markdown rendering
- **remark-gfm 4.0.1** — GitHub Flavored Markdown support
- **tailwind-merge 3.4.0** — Tailwind class merging utility

**Dev Dependencies**:
- **Playwright 1.52.0** — E2E testing (`@playwright/test`)
- **TypeScript 5** — Static typing
- **ESLint 9** — Code linting
- **Tailwind CSS PostCSS 4** — CSS processor

**Scripts** (in both `src/frontend/` and `prototype/`):
```
npm run dev           # Next.js dev server
npm run build         # Production build
npm run start         # Production server
npm run lint          # ESLint
npm run test:e2e      # Playwright headless
npm run test:e2e:ui   # Playwright UI mode
npm run test:e2e:headed   # Headed browser
npm run test:e2e:debug    # Debug mode
```

#### **Backend (Python 3.12+)**
**File**: `/home/hongbozhou/projects/poc/framer/src/backend/requirements.txt`

**Core Dependencies**:
- **fastapi >=0.109.0** — Web framework
- **uvicorn[standard] >=0.27.0** — ASGI server
- **pydantic >=2.5.0** — Data validation
- **httpx >=0.26.0** — Async HTTP client
- **pyyaml >=6.0.1** — YAML parsing
- **gitpython >=3.1.40** — Git operations (version control)

**AI Provider Support**:
- **anthropic >=0.40.0** — Claude API
- **openai >=1.10.0** — GPT API

**Vector Search**:
- **chromadb >=0.4.0** — Embedding & semantic search (optional)

**Testing**:
- **pytest >=8.0.0** — Test framework
- **pytest-asyncio >=0.23.0** — Async test support

**File**: `/home/hongbozhou/projects/poc/framer/src/backend/pyproject.toml`

**Project Metadata**:
- `name`: "framer-backend"
- `version`: "0.1.0"
- `requires-python`: ">=3.11"

**Additional Core Dependencies** (in pyproject.toml):
- **pydantic-settings >=2.1.0** — Environment configuration
- **aiosqlite >=0.19.0** — SQLite async driver
- **markdown-it-py >=3.0.0** — Markdown parsing
- **python-multipart >=0.0.6** — Form data parsing

**Optional Dependencies**:
- **[dev]**: pytest, pytest-asyncio, pytest-cov, httpx
- **[ai]**: agno >=0.1.0, openai >=1.10.0, anthropic >=0.18.0
- **[vector]**: chromadb >=0.4.0

---

### 4. CONFIGURATION FILES

#### **Environment Variables** (Multi-Environment Strategy)

**File Locations**:
```
config/.env.common          # Shared across all environments
config/.env.dev             # Development
config/.env.qa              # QA/Staging
config/.env.prod            # Production
config/ai.yaml              # AI provider config (mounted at /config/ai.yaml)
```

**Common Settings** (`.env.common`):
```
COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME=framer
REDACTED
BACKEND_CONTAINER_NAME=framer-backend
FRONTEND_CONTAINER_NAME=framer-frontend
POCKETBASE_IMAGE=ghcr.io/muchobien/pocketbase:latest
HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL=10s
HEALTHCHECK_TIMEOUT=5s
HEALTHCHECK_RETRIES=5

    app.state.conversations = ConversationService(...)

    # API routers registered

## Framer Project: Complete Architecture & Configuration Overview

### 1. PROJECT STRUCTURE

**Git Remote URL**: `https://github.com/ethannortharc/framer.git`

The project follows a monorepo structure with organized separation of concerns:

```
framer/
├── src/
│   ├── backend/                    # FastAPI application
│   │   ├── app/
│   │   │   ├── api/               # REST API endpoints (frames, conversations, knowledge, ai, admin)
│   │   │   ├── agents/            # AI agents (conversation, evaluator, generator, refiner)
│   │   │   ├── auth/              # PocketBase authentication
│   │   │   ├── models/            # Pydantic data models with YAML serialization
│   │   │   ├── services/          # Business logic (frame, conversation, knowledge, git, vector)
│   │   │   ├── config/            # Backend configuration
│   │   │   └── main.py            # FastAPI application factory
│   │   ├── requirements.txt        # Python dependencies
│   │   └── pyproject.toml          # Project metadata & optional dependencies
│   │
│   └── frontend/                   # Next.js 16 application
│       ├── src/
│       │   ├── app/               # App Router (dashboard, new, frame/[id], knowledge, admin, archive)
│       │   ├── components/        # React components (ui, layout, dashboard, frame, conversation)
│       │   ├── contexts/          # React contexts (AuthContext)
│       │   ├── lib/               # API client singleton, auth utilities, snake_case↔camelCase transforms
│       │   ├── store/             # Zustand state management
│       │   └── types/             # TypeScript types
│       └── package.json           # Node.js dependencies
│
├── prototype/                      # Alternative frontend build (used in Makefile)
│   ├── src/                        # Next.js app
│   ├── package.json
│   └── tests/                      # Playwright E2E tests
│
├── config/                         # Environment-specific configurations
│   ├── .env.common                 # Shared settings (container names, images, health checks)
│   ├── .env.dev                    # Development (localhost:3000, 8000, 8090)
│   ├── .env.qa                     # QA/Staging (qa subdomains)
│   ├── .env.prod                   # Production (example.com domains)
│   ├── ai.yaml                     # AI provider configuration (mounted in Docker)
│   └── README.md                   # Configuration documentation
│
├── data/templates/                 # Frame templates (bug-fix, feature, exploration)
├── pocketbase/pb_migrations/       # PocketBase migration files
├── scripts/docker.sh               # Docker Compose helper script
├── tests/backend/                  # Backend pytest tests
├── docs/screenshots/               # Application screenshots & design docs
│
├── docker-compose.yml              # Production/default configuration
├── docker-compose.dev.yml          # Development with hot-reload
├── Dockerfile.backend              # Python 3.12 multi-stage build
├── Dockerfile.frontend             # Node.js 20 multi-stage build
├── .dockerignore                   # Docker build exclusions
├── Makefile                        # Local development commands
├── README.md                        # Main documentation
└── .gitignore                      # Git exclusions
```

**Additional directories** (Go/Rust utilities, experimental):
- `cmd/` — Command-line tools (hx, hx-controller, hx-proxy, hx-agent)
- `pkg/` — Go packages (agent, cli, components, controller, core, protocol, sandbox, transport)
- `internal/` — Internal proxy adapters
- `holonex/` — Build infrastructure scaffolding
- `images/` — Docker image configurations (base, claude-code, codex)

---

### 2. DOCKER CONFIGURATION

#### **docker-compose.yml** (Production/Default)
Three services orchestrated with health checks and inter-service dependencies:

| Service | Image | Port | Dependencies | Purpose |
|---------|-------|------|--------------|---------|
| **pocketbase** | `ghcr.io/muchobien/pocketbase:latest` | 8090 | None | Authentication & database (migrations in `/pb_migrations`) |
| **backend** | Built from `Dockerfile.backend` | 8000 | pocketbase (healthy) | FastAPI REST API |
| **frontend** | Built from `Dockerfile.frontend` | 3000 | backend | Next.js SSR application |

- **Health checks**: All services have health checks with 10s interval, 5s timeout, 5 retries
- **Volumes**: Named volumes for `pocketbase_data` and `backend_data` persistence
- **Environment**: Loaded from `config/.env.dev`, `config/.env.qa`, or `config/.env.prod`

#### **docker-compose.dev.yml** (Development Hot-Reload)
Same three services but with:
- Mounted source code for live reloading
- Direct npm/uvicorn commands instead of Dockerfile entry points
- Separate dev-suffixed volume names

#### **Dockerfile.backend** (Python 3.12-slim)
- Base: `python:3.12-slim`
- Installs: git system dependency
- Copies: `src/backend/requirements.txt` → pip install
- Copies: `src/backend/app/` → `/app/app`
- Creates: Data directories for frames, templates, conversations, knowledge, vector_db
- Exposes: Port 8000
- CMD: `uvicorn app.main:get_app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000`

#### **Dockerfile.frontend** (Node.js 20-alpine, Multi-stage)
- **Stage 1 (deps)**: Install dependencies from `src/frontend/package.json`
- **Stage 2 (builder)**: Build Next.js with environment variables:
  - `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL` (default: `http://localhost:8000`)
  - `NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL` (default: `http://localhost:8090`)
- **Stage 3 (runner)**: Production image with non-root user `nextjs:nodejs`
- Exposes: Port 3000
- CMD: `node server.js` (Next.js standalone output)

---

  - `9bd0c39` — Frame preview, git diffs, AI retry fixes, README with screenshots
  - `68eb8fb` — Add `.entire/` to `.gitignore`
  - `2cc74d7` — Admin portal, multi-provider AI, frame review workflow
  - `90e6fe0` — Remove LLM endpoint from committed config
  - `9fee560` — Conversation-first framing, knowledge system, AI LLM integration

---

### 10. NOTES & GOTCHAS

- **TypeScript**: Frontend uses `unknown && expr` pattern (JSX children require ternary `x != null ? ... : null`)
- **Config**: `config/ai.yaml` is gitignored (security) but referenced in docker-compose; set via admin settings
- **Prototype vs Frontend**: `prototype/` is used in Makefile; `src/frontend/` is production build target
- **Environment Overrides**: `.env.local` can be created for local-only customization
- **Multi-environment**: Use `./scripts/docker.sh <env> <cmd>` for cross-environment management
- **Health Checks**: All Docker services have health checks before dependent services start
- **Volume Persistence**: Named volumes (`pocketbase_data`, `backend_data`) persist between restarts
- **AI Providers**: Supports Anthropic, OpenAI, and any OpenAI-compatible endpoint (MiniMax, GLM, local models)

---

This completes the comprehensive exploration of the Framer project structure, dependencies, and configuration.

file.content:
# Development Environment Configuration

# ============================================
# Ports (exposed to host)
# ============================================
POCKETBASE_PORT=8090
BACKEND_PORT=8000
FRONTEND_PORT=3000

# ============================================
# Service URLs (for inter-service communication)
# ============================================
# Internal URLs (within Docker network)
POCKETBASE_INTERNAL_URL=http://pocketbase:8090
BACKEND_INTERNAL_URL=http://backend:8000

# External URLs (from browser/client)
POCKETBASE_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:8090
BACKEND_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:8000
FRONTEND_EXTERNAL_URL=http://localhost:3000

# ============================================
# Frontend Configuration
# ============================================
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000
NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://localhost:8090
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_TIMEOUT=30000

# ============================================
# Backend Configuration
# ============================================
BACKEND_DATA_PATH=/data
BACKEND_LOG_LEVEL=debug
BACKEND_CORS_ORIGINS=http://localhost:3000,http://127.0.0.1:3000

# ============================================
# PocketBase Configuration
# ============================================
POCKETBASE_ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com
# POCKETBASE_ADMIN_PASSWORD should be set securely, not in version control

# ============================================
# Volume Paths (optional local mounts for development)
# ============================================
# Uncomment to persist data locally instead of Docker volumes
# POCKETBASE_DATA_PATH=./data/pocketbase
# BACKEND_DATA_PATH=./data/backend

# ============================================
# AI Configuration
# ============================================
# Primary config is in config/ai.yaml (mounted at /config/ai.yaml in Docker).
# Env vars below override ai.yaml values when non-empty.
# AI_PROVIDER=anthropic
# AI_MODEL=forti-coder
# AI_API_KEY=
# AI_ENDPOINT=
# AI_TEMPERATURE=0.7
# AI_MAX_TOKENS=4096
# AI_TIMEOUT=3000
# AI_SSL_VERIFY=false

# ============================================
# Debug Settings
# ============================================
DEBUG=true
NODE_ENV=development

file.content:
# Framer Backend Dockerfile
FROM python:3.12-slim

WORKDIR /app

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy requirements and install Python dependencies
COPY src/backend/requirements.txt .
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# Copy backend source code
COPY src/backend/app ./app

# Create data directories
RUN mkdir -p /data/frames /data/templates /data/conversations /data/knowledge /data/vector_db

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8000

# Run the application
CMD ["uvicorn", "app.main:get_app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000"]

file.content:
# Framer Frontend Dockerfile
FROM node:20-alpine AS base

# Install dependencies only when needed
FROM base AS deps
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat
WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files from production frontend
COPY src/frontend/package.json src/frontend/package-lock.json* ./
RUN npm ci

# Rebuild the source code only when needed
FROM base AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY src/frontend/ .

# Set build-time environment variables
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8000
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://localhost:8090
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# Production image, copy all the files and run next
FROM base AS runner
WORKDIR /app

ENV NODE_ENV=production

RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs
RUN adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs

# Copy built assets
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static

USER nextjs

EXPOSE 3000

ENV PORT=3000
ENV HOSTNAME="0.0.0.0"

CMD ["node", "server.js"]

ssh zhbo@10.83.80.29 "cat > ~/projects/framer/config/.env.deploy << 'EOF'
# Deployment on 10.83.80.29

# Project
COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME=framer

# Container Names
REDACTED
BACKEND_CONTAINER_NAME=framer-backend
FRONTEND_CONTAINER_NAME=framer-frontend

# Image Tags
POCKETBASE_IMAGE=ghcr.io/muchobien/pocketbase:latest

# Ports
POCKETBASE_PORT=8090
BACKEND_PORT=8000
FRONTEND_PORT=3000

# Internal URLs (within Docker network)
POCKETBASE_INTERNAL_URL=http://pocketbase:8090
BACKEND_INTERNAL_URL=http://backend:8000

# External URLs (from browser - use machine IP)
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=http://10.83.80.29:8000
NEXT_PUBLIC_POCKETBASE_URL=http://10.83.80.29:8090
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_TIMEOUT=30000

# Backend Configuration
BACKEND_DATA_PATH=/data
BACKEND_LOG_LEVEL=info
BACKEND_CORS_ORIGINS=http://10.83.80.29:3000,http://localhost:3000

# PocketBase Admin
POCKETBASE_ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@framer.local
REDACTED

# Health Check Settings
HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL=10s
HEALTHCHECK_TIMEOUT=5s
HEALTHCHECK_RETRIES=5

# Restart Policy
RESTART_POLICY=unless-stopped

# Runtime
DEBUG=false
NODE_ENV=production
EOF
echo 'Env file created successfully'"

Let me explore the codebase to understand both issues.

content.content:
1→"""
     2→Frame data models for Framer.
     3→
     4→These models define the structure of frames, their metadata, and content.
     5→"""
     6→import re
     7→from datetime import datetime, timezone
     8→from enum import Enum
     9→from typing import Any, Optional
    10→
    11→import yaml
    12→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, field_validator
    13→
    14→
    15→class FrameStatus(str, Enum):
    16→    """Status of a frame in its lifecycle."""
    17→    DRAFT = "draft"
    18→    IN_REVIEW = "in_review"
    19→    READY = "ready"
    20→    FEEDBACK = "feedback"
    21→    ARCHIVED = "archived"
    22→
    23→
    24→class FrameType(str, Enum):
    25→    """Type of frame (determines template used)."""
    26→    BUG = "bug"
    27→    FEATURE = "feature"
    28→    EXPLORATION = "exploration"
    29→
    30→
    31→# Regex pattern for valid frame IDs: f-YYYY-MM-DD-xxxxxx
    32→FRAME_ID_PATTERN = re.compile(r"^f-\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$")
    33→
    34→
    35→class FrameMeta(BaseModel):
    36→    """Metadata for a frame (stored in meta.yaml)."""
    37→    id: str
    38→    type: FrameType
    39→    status: FrameStatus
    40→    owner: str
    41→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    42→    reviewer: Optional[str] = None
    43→    approver: Optional[str] = None
    44→    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
    45→    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
    46→
    47→    # AI evaluation fields (optional)
    48→    ai_score: Optional[int] = None
    49→    ai_evaluated_at: Optional[datetime] = None
    50→    ai_breakdown: Optional[dict[str, int]] = None
    51→    ai_feedback: Optional[str] = None
    52→    ai_issues: Optional[list[str]] = None
    53→
    54→    # Review summary fields (optional)
    55→    review_summary: Optional[str] = None
    56→    review_comments: Optional[list[dict]] = None
    57→    review_recommendation: Optional[str] = None
    58→
    59→    @field_validator("id")
    60→    @classmethod
    61→    def validate_frame_id(cls, v: str) -> str:
    62→        """Validate frame ID matches expected pattern."""
    63→        if not FRAME_ID_PATTERN.match(v):
    64→            raise ValueError(
    65→                f"Frame ID must match pattern 'f-YYYY-MM-DD-xxxxxx', got: {v}"
    66→            )
    67→        return v
    68→
    69→    def to_yaml(self) -> str:
    70→        """Serialize to YAML format for meta.yaml file."""
    71→        data = {
    72→            "id": self.id,
    73→            "type": self.type.value,
    74→            "status": self.status.value,
    75→            "owner": self.owner,
    76→        }
    77→        if self.project_id:
    78→            data["project_id"] = self.project_id
    79→        if self.reviewer:
    80→            data["reviewer"] = self.reviewer
    81→        if self.approver:
    82→            data["approver"] = self.approver
    83→        data["created_at"] = self.created_at.isoformat()
    84→        data["updated_at"] = self.updated_at.isoformat()
    85→        if self.ai_score is not None:
    86→            data["ai"] = {
    87→                "score": self.ai_score,
    88→                "evaluated_at": self.ai_evaluated_at.isoformat() if self.ai_evaluated_at else None,
    89→                "breakdown": self.ai_breakdown,
    90→                "feedback": self.ai_feedback,
    91→                "issues": self.ai_issues,
    92→            }
    93→        if self.review_summary or self.review_comments or self.review_recommendation:
    94→            data["review"] = {
    95→                "summary": self.review_summary,
    96→                "comments": self.review_comments,
    97→                "recommendation": self.review_recommendation,
    98→            }
    99→        return yaml.dump(data, default_flow_style=False, sort_keys=False)
   100→
   101→    @classmethod
   102→    def from_yaml(cls, yaml_str: str) -> "FrameMeta":
   103→        """Deserialize from YAML format."""
   104→        data = yaml.safe_load(yaml_str)
   105→
   106→        # Handle AI fields if present
   107→        ai_score = None
   108→        ai_evaluated_at = None
   109→        ai_breakdown = None
   110→        ai_feedback = None
   111→        ai_issues = None
   112→        if "ai" in data:
   113→            ai_data = data["ai"]
   114→            ai_score = ai_data.get("score")
   115→            ai_evaluated_at = ai_data.get("evaluated_at")
   116→            ai_breakdown = ai_data.get("breakdown")
   117→            ai_feedback = ai_data.get("feedback")
   118→            ai_issues = ai_data.get("issues")
   119→
   120→        # Handle review fields if present
   121→        review_summary = None
   122→        review_comments = None
   123→        review_recommendation = None
   124→        if "review" in data:
   125→            review_data = data["review"]
   126→            review_summary = review_data.get("summary")
   127→            review_comments = review_data.get("comments")
   128→            review_recommendation = review_data.get("recommendation")
   129→
   130→        return cls(
   131→            id=data["id"],
   132→            type=FrameType(data["type"]),
   133→            status=FrameStatus(data["status"]),
   134→            owner=data["owner"],
   135→            project_id=data.get("project_id"),
   136→            reviewer=data.get("reviewer"),
   137→            approver=data.get("approver"),
   138→            created_at=datetime.fromisoformat(data["created_at"].replace("Z", "+00:00"))
   139→                if isinstance(data["created_at"], str) else data["created_at"],
   140→            updated_at=datetime.fromisoformat(data["updated_at"].replace("Z", "+00:00"))
   141→                if isinstance(data["updated_at"], str) else data["updated_at"],
   142→            ai_score=ai_score,
   143→            ai_evaluated_at=ai_evaluated_at,
   144→            ai_breakdown=ai_breakdown,
   145→            ai_feedback=ai_feedback,
   146→            ai_issues=ai_issues,
   147→            review_summary=review_summary,
   148→            review_comments=review_comments,
   149→            review_recommendation=review_recommendation,
   150→        )
   151→
   152→
   153→class FrameContent(BaseModel):
   154→    """Content of a frame (parsed from frame.md)."""
   155→    problem_statement: Optional[str] = None
   156→    user_perspective: Optional[str] = None
   157→    engineering_framing: Optional[str] = None
   158→    validation_thinking: Optional[str] = None
   159→
   160→    def to_markdown(self, frame_id: str, frame_type: FrameType) -> str:
   161→        """Serialize to Markdown format for frame.md file."""
   162→        lines = [
   163→            "---",
   164→            f"id: {frame_id}",
   165→            f"type: {frame_type.value}",
   166→            "---",
   167→            "",
   168→            "# Problem Statement",
   169→            "",
   170→            self.problem_statement or "",
   171→            "",
   172→            "## User Perspective",
   173→            "",
   174→            self.user_perspective or "",
   175→            "",
   176→            "## Engineering Framing",
   177→            "",
   178→            self.engineering_framing or "",
   179→            "",
   180→            "## Validation Thinking",
   181→            "",
   182→            self.validation_thinking or "",
   183→        ]
   184→        return "\n".join(lines)
   185→
   186→    @classmethod
   187→    def from_markdown(cls, md_str: str) -> "FrameContent":
   188→        """Deserialize from Markdown format."""
   189→        # Remove YAML frontmatter
   190→        content = md_str
   191→        if content.startswith("---"):
   192→            parts = content.split("---", 2)
   193→            if len(parts) >= 3:
   194→                content = parts[2]
   195→
   196→        # Parse sections
   197→        sections = {}
   198→        current_section = None
   199→        current_content = []
   200→
   201→        section_map = {
   202→            "# problem statement": "problem_statement",
   203→            "## user perspective": "user_perspective",
   204→            "## engineering framing": "engineering_framing",
   205→            "## validation thinking": "validation_thinking",
   206→        }
   207→
   208→        for line in content.split("\n"):
   209→            line_lower = line.lower().strip()
   210→
   211→            # Check if this is a section header
   212→            matched_section = None
   213→            for header, field in section_map.items():
   214→                if line_lower == header:
   215→                    matched_section = field
   216→                    break
   217→
   218→            if matched_section:
   219→                # Save previous section
   220→                if current_section:
   221→                    sections[current_section] = "\n".join(current_content).strip()
   222→                current_section = matched_section
   223→                current_content = []
   224→            elif current_section:
   225→                current_content.append(line)
   226→
   227→        # Save last section
   228→        if current_section:
   229→            sections[current_section] = "\n".join(current_content).strip()
   230→
   231→        return cls(**sections)
   232→
   233→
   234→class Frame(BaseModel):
   235→    """Complete frame combining metadata and content."""
   236→    meta: FrameMeta
   237→    content: FrameContent
   238→
   239→    @property
   240→    def id(self) -> str:
   241→        """Convenience property for frame ID."""
   242→        return self.meta.id
   243→
   244→    @property
   245→    def status(self) -> FrameStatus:
   246→        """Convenience property for frame status."""
   247→        return self.meta.status
   248→
   249→    @property
   250→    def type(self) -> FrameType:
   251→        """Convenience property for frame type."""
   252→        return self.meta.type
   253→
   254→    @property
   255→    def owner(self) -> str:
   256→        """Convenience property for frame owner."""
   257→        return self.meta.owner
   258→
   259→
   260→class Comment(BaseModel):
   261→    """Comment on a frame section."""
   262→    id: str
   263→    section: str
   264→    author: str
   265→    content: str
   266→    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
   267→
