1→"""
     2→Frames API endpoints.
     3→"""
     4→from typing import Optional
     5→
     6→from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request, status
     7→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
     8→
     9→import logging
    10→
    11→from app.models.frame import Frame, FrameContent, FrameStatus, FrameType, Comment
    12→from app.services.frame_service import FrameService, FrameNotFoundError
    13→from app.services.git_service import GitService
    14→from app.auth.pocketbase import get_current_user, User
    15→
    16→logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    17→
    18→
    19→# Request/Response models
    20→class CreateFrameRequest(BaseModel):
    21→    """Request body for creating a frame."""
    22→    type: FrameType
    23→    owner: str
    24→    content: Optional[dict] = None
    25→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    26→
    27→
    28→class UpdateFrameRequest(BaseModel):
    29→    """Request body for updating a frame."""
    30→    content: dict
    31→
    32→
    33→class UpdateStatusRequest(BaseModel):
    34→    """Request body for updating frame status."""
    35→    status: FrameStatus
    36→
    37→
    38→class UpdateMetaRequest(BaseModel):
    39→    """Request body for updating frame metadata."""
    40→    reviewer: Optional[str] = None
    41→    approver: Optional[str] = None
    42→
    43→
    44→class SubmitFeedbackRequest(BaseModel):
    45→    """Request body for submitting implementation feedback."""
    46→    outcome: str  # success | partial | failed
    47→    summary: str
    48→    lessons_learned: list[str] = Field(default_factory=list)
    49→
    50→
    51→class CreateCommentRequest(BaseModel):
    52→    """Request body for creating a comment."""
    53→    section: str
    54→    author: str
    55→    content: str
    56→
    57→
    58→class FrameResponse(BaseModel):
    59→    """Response model for a frame."""
    60→    id: str
    61→    type: str
    62→    status: str
    63→    owner: str
    64→    content: dict
    65→    meta: dict
    66→
    67→    @classmethod
    68→    def from_frame(cls, frame: Frame) -> "FrameResponse":
    69→        return cls(
    70→            id=frame.id,
    71→            type=frame.type.value,
    72→            status=frame.status.value,
    73→            owner=frame.owner,
    74→            content={
    75→                "problem_statement": frame.content.problem_statement,
    76→                "user_perspective": frame.content.user_perspective,
    77→                "engineering_framing": frame.content.engineering_framing,
    78→                "validation_thinking": frame.content.validation_thinking,
    79→            },
    80→            meta={
    81→                "created_at": frame.meta.created_at.isoformat(),
    82→                "updated_at": frame.meta.updated_at.isoformat(),
    83→                "project_id": frame.meta.project_id,
    84→                "ai_score": frame.meta.ai_score,
    85→                "ai_breakdown": frame.meta.ai_breakdown,
    86→                "ai_feedback": frame.meta.ai_feedback,
    87→                "ai_issues": frame.meta.ai_issues,
    88→                "reviewer": frame.meta.reviewer,
    89→                "approver": frame.meta.approver,
    90→                "review_summary": frame.meta.review_summary,
    91→                "review_comments": frame.meta.review_comments,
    92→                "review_recommendation": frame.meta.review_recommendation,
    93→            }
    94→        )
    95→
    96→
    97→class FrameListItem(BaseModel):
    98→    """Response model for frame list item."""
    99→    id: str
   100→    type: str
   101→    status: str
   102→    owner: str
   103→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
   104→    reviewer: Optional[str] = None
   105→    approver: Optional[str] = None
   106→    updated_at: str
   107→
   108→
   109→class CommentResponse(BaseModel):
   110→    """Response model for a comment."""
   111→    id: str
   112→    section: str
   113→    author: str
   114→    content: str
   115→    created_at: str
   116→
   117→
   118→class FrameHistoryEntry(BaseModel):
   119→    """Response model for a frame history entry."""
   120→    hash: str
   121→    message: str
   122→    author_name: str
   123→    timestamp: str
   124→    diff: Optional[str] = None
   125→
   126→
   127→def get_frame_service(request: Request) -> FrameService:
   128→    """Dependency to get the frame service from app state."""
   129→    return request.app.state.frame_service
   130→
   131→
   132→def get_git_service(request: Request) -> GitService:
   133→    """Dependency to get the git service from app state."""
   134→    return request.app.state.git_service
   135→
   136→
   137→def _git_commit(git_service: GitService, frame_id: str, message: str, author_name: str = "Framer", author_email: str = "framer@system") -> None:
   138→    """Auto-commit frame changes. Non-blocking, errors are logged."""
   139→    try:
   140→        git_service.commit_frame_changes(
   141→            frame_id=frame_id,
   142→            message=message,
   143→            author_name=author_name,
   144→            author_email=author_email,
   145→        )
   146→    except Exception as e:
   147→        logger.warning("Git commit failed for frame %s: %s", frame_id, e)
   148→
   149→
   150→def create_frames_router(require_auth: bool = False) -> APIRouter:
   151→    """Create the frames API router.
   152→
   153→    Args:
   154→        require_auth: If True, all mutating endpoints require authentication.
   155→    """
   156→    router = APIRouter()
   157→
   158→    # Build dependencies list based on auth requirement
   159→    def get_auth_dependencies():
   160→        if require_auth:
   161→            return [Depends(get_current_user)]
   162→        return []
   163→
   164→    @router.post("", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED, dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   165→    def create_frame(
   166→        request: CreateFrameRequest,
   167→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   168→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   169→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   170→        """Create a new frame."""
   171→        content = None
   172→        if request.content:
   173→            content = FrameContent(**request.content)
   174→
   175→        frame = frame_service.create_frame(
   176→            frame_type=request.type,
   177→            owner=request.owner,
   178→            content=content,
   179→            project_id=request.project_id,
   180→        )
   181→
   182→        _git_commit(git_service, frame.id, f"Create {request.type.value} frame")
   183→
   184→        return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   185→
   186→    @router.get("/{frame_id}")
   187→    def get_frame(
   188→        frame_id: str,
   189→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   190→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   191→        """Get a frame by ID."""
   192→        try:
   193→            frame = frame_service.get_frame(frame_id)
   194→            return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   195→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   196→            raise HTTPException(
   197→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   198→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   199→            )
   200→
   201→    @router.get("")
   202→    def list_frames(
   203→        status: Optional[str] = None,
   204→        owner: Optional[str] = None,
   205→        project_id: Optional[str] = None,
   206→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   207→    ) -> list[FrameListItem]:
   208→        """List all frames with optional filters."""
   209→        frames = frame_service.list_frames(project_id=project_id)
   210→
   211→        # Apply filters
   212→        if status:
   213→            frames = [f for f in frames if f.status.value == status]
   214→        if owner:
   215→            frames = [f for f in frames if f.owner == owner]
   216→
   217→        return [
   218→            FrameListItem(
   219→                id=f.id,
   220→                type=f.type.value,
   221→                status=f.status.value,
   222→                owner=f.owner,
   223→                project_id=f.meta.project_id,
   224→                reviewer=f.meta.reviewer,
   225→                approver=f.meta.approver,
   226→                updated_at=f.meta.updated_at.isoformat(),
   227→            )
   228→            for f in frames
   229→        ]
   230→
   231→    @router.put("/{frame_id}", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   232→    def update_frame(
   233→        frame_id: str,
   234→        request: UpdateFrameRequest,
   235→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   236→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   237→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   238→        """Update a frame's content."""
   239→        try:
   240→            content = FrameContent(**request.content)
   241→            frame = frame_service.update_frame_content(frame_id, content)
   242→            _git_commit(git_service, frame_id, "Update frame content")
   243→            return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   244→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   245→            raise HTTPException(
   246→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   247→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   248→            )
   249→
   250→    @router.patch("/{frame_id}/status", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   251→    def update_status(
   252→        frame_id: str,
   253→        request: UpdateStatusRequest,
   254→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   255→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   256→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   257→        """Update a frame's status."""
   258→        try:
   259→            frame = frame_service.update_frame_status(frame_id, request.status)
   260→            _git_commit(git_service, frame_id, f"Status → {request.status.value}")
   261→            return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   262→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   263→            raise HTTPException(
   264→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   265→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   266→            )
   267→        except ValueError as e:
   268→            raise HTTPException(
   269→                status_code=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
   270→                detail=str(e),
   271→            )
   272→
   273→    @router.patch("/{frame_id}/meta", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   274→    def update_meta(
   275→        frame_id: str,
   276→        request: UpdateMetaRequest,
   277→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   278→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   279→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   280→        """Update frame metadata (reviewer, approver)."""
   281→        try:
   282→            frame = frame_service.update_frame_meta(
   283→                frame_id,
   284→                reviewer=request.reviewer,
   285→                approver=request.approver,
   286→            )
   287→            _git_commit(git_service, frame_id, "Update frame metadata")
   288→            return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   289→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   290→            raise HTTPException(
   291→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   292→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   293→            )
   294→
   295→    @router.post("/{frame_id}/feedback", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   296→    def submit_feedback(
   297→        frame_id: str,
   298→        request: SubmitFeedbackRequest,
   299→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   300→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   301→    ) -> FrameResponse:
   302→        """Submit implementation feedback and archive the frame."""
   303→        try:
   304→            frame_service.add_feedback(
   305→                frame_id=frame_id,
   306→                went_well=request.summary if request.outcome == "success" else "",
   307→                could_improve=request.summary if request.outcome != "success" else "",
   308→                lessons_learned="\n".join(f"- {l}" for l in request.lessons_learned) if request.lessons_learned else "",
   309→            )
   310→            frame = frame_service.update_frame_status(frame_id, FrameStatus.ARCHIVED)
   311→            _git_commit(git_service, frame_id, f"Feedback: {request.outcome}")
   312→            return FrameResponse.from_frame(frame)
   313→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   314→            raise HTTPException(
   315→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   316→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   317→            )
   318→
   319→    @router.delete("/{frame_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT, dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   320→    def delete_frame(
   321→        frame_id: str,
   322→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   323→    ):
   324→        """Delete a frame."""
   325→        try:
   326→            frame_service.delete_frame(frame_id)
   327→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   328→            raise HTTPException(
   329→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   330→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   331→            )
   332→
   333→    @router.post("/{frame_id}/comments", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED, dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   334→    def add_comment(
   335→        frame_id: str,
   336→        request: CreateCommentRequest,
   337→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   338→    ) -> CommentResponse:
   339→        """Add a comment to a frame."""
   340→        try:
   341→            comment = frame_service.add_comment(
   342→                frame_id=frame_id,
   343→                section=request.section,
   344→                author=request.author,
   345→                content=request.content,
   346→            )
   347→            return CommentResponse(
   348→                id=comment.id,
   349→                section=comment.section,
   350→                author=comment.author,
   351→                content=comment.content,
   352→                created_at=comment.created_at.isoformat(),
   353→            )
   354→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   355→            raise HTTPException(
   356→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   357→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   358→            )
   359→
   360→    @router.get("/{frame_id}/comments")
   361→    def get_comments(
   362→        frame_id: str,
   363→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   364→    ) -> list[CommentResponse]:
   365→        """Get all comments for a frame."""
   366→        try:
   367→            comments = frame_service.get_comments(frame_id)
   368→            return [
   369→                CommentResponse(
   370→                    id=c.id,
   371→                    section=c.section,
   372→                    author=c.author,
   373→                    content=c.content,
   374→                    created_at=c.created_at.isoformat(),
   375→                )
   376→                for c in comments
   377→            ]
   378→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   379→            raise HTTPException(
   380→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   381→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   382→            )
   383→
   384→    @router.get("/{frame_id}/history")
   385→    def get_frame_history(
   386→        frame_id: str,
   387→        limit: int = 20,
   388→        include_diff: bool = True,
   389→        frame_service: FrameService = Depends(get_frame_service),
   390→        git_service: GitService = Depends(get_git_service),
   391→    ) -> list[FrameHistoryEntry]:
   392→        """Get version history for a frame."""
   393→        # Verify frame exists
   394→        try:
   395→            frame_service.get_frame(frame_id)
   396→        except FrameNotFoundError:
   397→            raise HTTPException(
   398→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   399→                detail=f"Frame not found: {frame_id}",
   400→            )
   401→
   402→        history = git_service.get_frame_history(frame_id, limit=limit)
   403→        return [
   404→            FrameHistoryEntry(
   405→                hash=entry["hash"],
   406→                message=entry["message"],
   407→                author_name=entry["author_name"],
   408→                timestamp=entry["timestamp"].isoformat(),
   409→                diff=git_service.get_commit_diff(entry["hash"]) if include_diff else None,
   410→            )
   411→            for entry in history
   412→        ]
   413→
   414→    return router
   415→

content.content:
1→"""
     2→Frame Service for file-based frame operations.
     3→
     4→This service handles CRUD operations for frames using the file system.
     5→"""
     6→import json
     7→import shutil
     8→import uuid
     9→from datetime import datetime, timezone
    10→from pathlib import Path
    11→from typing import Optional
    12→
    13→from app.models.frame import (
    14→    Frame,
    15→    FrameContent,
    16→    FrameMeta,
    17→    FrameStatus,
    18→    FrameType,
    19→    Comment,
    20→)
    21→
    22→
    23→class FrameNotFoundError(Exception):
    24→    """Raised when a frame is not found."""
    25→    pass
    26→
    27→
    28→class FrameService:
    29→    """Service for managing frames via file system."""
    30→
    31→    def __init__(self, data_path: Path):
    32→        """Initialize the service with the data directory path."""
    33→        self.data_path = Path(data_path)
    34→        self.frames_path = self.data_path / "frames"
    35→
    36→    def _generate_frame_id(self) -> str:
    37→        """Generate a unique frame ID."""
    38→        date_str = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    39→        unique_suffix = uuid.uuid4().hex[:6]
    40→        return f"f-{date_str}-{unique_suffix}"
    41→
    42→    def _get_frame_dir(self, frame_id: str) -> Path:
    43→        """Get the directory path for a frame."""
    44→        return self.frames_path / frame_id
    45→
    46→    def create_frame(
    47→        self,
    48→        frame_type: FrameType,
    49→        owner: str,
    50→        content: Optional[FrameContent] = None,
    51→        project_id: Optional[str] = None,
    52→    ) -> Frame:
    53→        """Create a new frame."""
    54→        frame_id = self._generate_frame_id()
    55→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
    56→        frame_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    57→
    58→        # Create metadata
    59→        meta = FrameMeta(
    60→            id=frame_id,
    61→            type=frame_type,
    62→            status=FrameStatus.DRAFT,
    63→            owner=owner,
    64→            project_id=project_id,
    65→        )
    66→
    67→        # Create content (empty if not provided)
    68→        if content is None:
    69→            content = FrameContent()
    70→
    71→        # Write meta.yaml
    72→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
    73→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
    74→
    75→        # Write frame.md
    76→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
    77→        frame_file.write_text(content.to_markdown(frame_id, frame_type))
    78→
    79→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
    80→
    81→    def get_frame(self, frame_id: str) -> Frame:
    82→        """Get a frame by ID."""
    83→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
    84→
    85→        if not frame_dir.exists():
    86→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
    87→
    88→        # Read meta.yaml
    89→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
    90→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
    91→
    92→        # Read frame.md
    93→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
    94→        content = FrameContent.from_markdown(frame_file.read_text())
    95→
    96→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
    97→
    98→    def list_frames(self, project_id: Optional[str] = None) -> list[Frame]:
    99→        """List all frames, optionally filtered by project_id."""
   100→        frames = []
   101→
   102→        if not self.frames_path.exists():
   103→            return frames
   104→
   105→        for frame_dir in self.frames_path.iterdir():
   106→            if frame_dir.is_dir() and frame_dir.name.startswith("f-"):
   107→                try:
   108→                    frame = self.get_frame(frame_dir.name)
   109→                    if project_id is not None and frame.meta.project_id != project_id:
   110→                        continue
   111→                    frames.append(frame)
   112→                except Exception:
   113→                    # Skip invalid frames
   114→                    pass
   115→
   116→        return frames
   117→
   118→    def update_frame_content(self, frame_id: str, content: FrameContent) -> Frame:
   119→        """Update frame content."""
   120→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   121→
   122→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   123→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   124→
   125→        # Read current meta
   126→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
   127→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
   128→
   129→        # Update timestamp
   130→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   131→
   132→        # Write updated meta
   133→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   134→
   135→        # Write updated content
   136→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
   137→        frame_file.write_text(content.to_markdown(frame_id, meta.type))
   138→
   139→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
   140→
   141→    def update_frame_meta(
   142→        self,
   143→        frame_id: str,
   144→        reviewer: Optional[str] = None,
   145→        approver: Optional[str] = None,
   146→    ) -> Frame:
   147→        """Update frame metadata (reviewer, approver)."""
   148→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   149→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   150→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   151→
   152→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
   153→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
   154→
   155→        if reviewer is not None:
   156→            meta.reviewer = reviewer
   157→        if approver is not None:
   158→            meta.approver = approver
   159→
   160→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   161→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   162→
   163→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
   164→        content = FrameContent.from_markdown(frame_file.read_text())
   165→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
   166→
   167→    def update_frame_status(self, frame_id: str, status: FrameStatus) -> Frame:
   168→        """Update frame status."""
   169→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   170→
   171→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   172→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   173→
   174→        # Read current meta
   175→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
   176→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
   177→
   178→        # Update status and timestamp
   179→        meta.status = status
   180→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   181→
   182→        # Write updated meta
   183→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   184→
   185→        # Read content
   186→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
   187→        content = FrameContent.from_markdown(frame_file.read_text())
   188→
   189→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
   190→
   191→    def save_evaluation(
   192→        self,
   193→        frame_id: str,
   194→        score: int,
   195→        breakdown: dict[str, int],
   196→        feedback: str,
   197→        issues: list[str],
   198→    ) -> Frame:
   199→        """Persist AI evaluation results to frame metadata."""
   200→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   201→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   202→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   203→
   204→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
   205→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
   206→
   207→        meta.ai_score = score
   208→        meta.ai_breakdown = breakdown
   209→        meta.ai_feedback = feedback
   210→        meta.ai_issues = issues
   211→        meta.ai_evaluated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   212→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   213→
   214→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   215→
   216→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
   217→        content = FrameContent.from_markdown(frame_file.read_text())
   218→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
   219→
   220→    def save_review_summary(
   221→        self,
   222→        frame_id: str,
   223→        summary: str,
   224→        comments: list[dict],
   225→        recommendation: str,
   226→    ) -> Frame:
   227→        """Save review summary to frame metadata."""
   228→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   229→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   230→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   231→
   232→        meta_file = frame_dir / "meta.yaml"
   233→        meta = FrameMeta.from_yaml(meta_file.read_text())
   234→
   235→        meta.review_summary = summary
   236→        meta.review_comments = comments
   237→        meta.review_recommendation = recommendation
   238→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   239→
   240→        meta_file.write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   241→
   242→        frame_file = frame_dir / "frame.md"
   243→        content = FrameContent.from_markdown(frame_file.read_text())
   244→        return Frame(meta=meta, content=content)
   245→
   246→    def delete_frame(self, frame_id: str) -> None:
   247→        """Delete a frame."""
   248→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   249→
   250→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   251→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   252→
   253→        shutil.rmtree(frame_dir)
   254→
   255→    def add_comment(
   256→        self,
   257→        frame_id: str,
   258→        section: str,
   259→        author: str,
   260→        content: str,
   261→    ) -> Comment:
   262→        """Add a comment to a frame."""
   263→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   264→
   265→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   266→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   267→
   268→        comments_file = frame_dir / "comments.json"
   269→
   270→        # Load existing comments or create new structure
   271→        if comments_file.exists():
   272→            data = json.loads(comments_file.read_text())
   273→        else:
   274→            data = {"comments": []}
   275→
   276→        # Create new comment
   277→        comment_id = f"c-{len(data['comments']) + 1:03d}"
   278→        comment = Comment(
   279→            id=comment_id,
   280→            section=section,
   281→            author=author,
   282→            content=content,
   283→        )
   284→
   285→        # Add to list
   286→        data["comments"].append({
   287→            "id": comment.id,
   288→            "section": comment.section,
   289→            "author": comment.author,
   290→            "content": comment.content,
   291→            "created_at": comment.created_at.isoformat(),
   292→        })
   293→
   294→        # Write back
   295→        comments_file.write_text(json.dumps(data, indent=2))
   296→
   297→        return comment
   298→
   299→    def get_comments(self, frame_id: str) -> list[Comment]:
   300→        """Get all comments for a frame."""
   301→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   302→
   303→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   304→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   305→
   306→        comments_file = frame_dir / "comments.json"
   307→
   308→        if not comments_file.exists():
   309→            return []
   310→
   311→        data = json.loads(comments_file.read_text())
   312→        comments = []
   313→
   314→        for c in data.get("comments", []):
   315→            comments.append(Comment(
   316→                id=c["id"],
   317→                section=c["section"],
   318→                author=c["author"],
   319→                content=c["content"],
   320→                created_at=datetime.fromisoformat(c["created_at"]) if "created_at" in c else datetime.now(timezone.utc),
   321→            ))
   322→
   323→        return comments
   324→
   325→    def add_feedback(
   326→        self,
   327→        frame_id: str,
   328→        went_well: str,
   329→        could_improve: str,
   330→        lessons_learned: str,
   331→    ) -> None:
   332→        """Add feedback/retrospective to a frame."""
   333→        frame_dir = self._get_frame_dir(frame_id)
   334→
   335→        if not frame_dir.exists():
   336→            raise FrameNotFoundError(f"Frame not found: {frame_id}")
   337→
   338→        feedback_file = frame_dir / "feedback.md"
   339→
   340→        feedback_content = f"""# Feedback & Retrospective
   341→
   342→## What Went Well
   343→
   344→{went_well}
   345→
   346→## What Could Be Improved
   347→
   348→{could_improve}
   349→
   350→## Lessons Learned
   351→
   352→{lessons_learned}
   353→"""
   354→
   355→        feedback_file.write_text(feedback_content)
   356→

1→"""
     2→Conversation data models for Framer.
     3→
     4→Conversations represent AI-guided dialogue sessions that produce structured Frames.
     5→"""
     6→import re
     7→from datetime import datetime, timezone
     8→from enum import Enum
     9→from typing import Any, Optional
    10→
    11→import yaml
    12→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, field_validator
    13→
    14→
    15→class ConversationStatus(str, Enum):
    16→    """Status of a conversation."""
    17→    ACTIVE = "active"
    18→    SYNTHESIZED = "synthesized"
    19→    ABANDONED = "abandoned"
    20→
    21→
    22→class ConversationPurpose(str, Enum):
    23→    """Purpose of a conversation."""
    24→    AUTHORING = "authoring"
    25→    REVIEW = "review"
    26→
    27→
    28→# Regex pattern for valid conversation IDs: conv-YYYY-MM-DD-xxxxxx
    29→CONVERSATION_ID_PATTERN = re.compile(r"^conv-\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}-[a-zA-Z0-9]+$")
    30→
    31→
    32→class ConversationMessage(BaseModel):
    33→    """A single message in a conversation."""
    34→    id: str
    35→    role: str = Field(description="user or assistant")
    36→    content: str
    37→    timestamp: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
    38→    metadata: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None
    39→
    40→
    41→class ConversationState(BaseModel):
    42→    """Tracks what the AI has learned from the conversation so far."""
    43→    frame_type: Optional[str] = None
    44→    sections_covered: dict[str, float] = Field(
    45→        default_factory=lambda: {
    46→            "problem_statement": 0.0,
    47→            "user_perspective": 0.0,
    48→            "engineering_framing": 0.0,
    49→            "validation_thinking": 0.0,
    50→        }
    51→    )
    52→    extracted_content: dict[str, str] = Field(default_factory=dict)
    53→    gaps: list[str] = Field(default_factory=list)
    54→    ready_to_synthesize: bool = False
    55→
    56→
    57→class ConversationMeta(BaseModel):
    58→    """Metadata for a conversation (stored in meta.yaml)."""
    59→    id: str
    60→    frame_id: Optional[str] = None
    61→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    62→    owner: str
    63→    purpose: ConversationPurpose = ConversationPurpose.AUTHORING
    64→    status: ConversationStatus = ConversationStatus.ACTIVE
    65→    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
    66→    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))
    67→
    68→    @field_validator("id")
    69→    @classmethod
    70→    def validate_conversation_id(cls, v: str) -> str:
    71→        if not CONVERSATION_ID_PATTERN.match(v):
    72→            raise ValueError(
    73→                f"Conversation ID must match pattern 'conv-YYYY-MM-DD-xxxxxx', got: {v}"
    74→            )
    75→        return v
    76→
    77→    def to_yaml(self) -> str:
    78→        data = {
    79→            "id": self.id,
    80→            "owner": self.owner,
    81→            "purpose": self.purpose.value,
    82→            "status": self.status.value,
    83→            "created_at": self.created_at.isoformat(),
    84→            "updated_at": self.updated_at.isoformat(),
    85→        }
    86→        if self.frame_id:
    87→            data["frame_id"] = self.frame_id
    88→        if self.project_id:
    89→            data["project_id"] = self.project_id
    90→        return yaml.dump(data, default_flow_style=False, sort_keys=False)
    91→
    92→    @classmethod
    93→    def from_yaml(cls, yaml_str: str) -> "ConversationMeta":
    94→        data = yaml.safe_load(yaml_str)
    95→        purpose_str = data.get("purpose", "authoring")
    96→        return cls(
    97→            id=data["id"],
    98→            owner=data["owner"],
    99→            purpose=ConversationPurpose(purpose_str),
   100→            status=ConversationStatus(data["status"]),
   101→            frame_id=data.get("frame_id"),
   102→            project_id=data.get("project_id"),
   103→            created_at=datetime.fromisoformat(data["created_at"].replace("Z", "+00:00"))
   104→                if isinstance(data["created_at"], str) else data["created_at"],
   105→            updated_at=datetime.fromisoformat(data["updated_at"].replace("Z", "+00:00"))
   106→                if isinstance(data["updated_at"], str) else data["updated_at"],
   107→        )
   108→
   109→
   110→class Conversation(BaseModel):
   111→    """Complete conversation combining metadata, messages, and state."""
   112→    meta: ConversationMeta
   113→    messages: list[ConversationMessage] = Field(default_factory=list)
   114→    state: ConversationState = Field(default_factory=ConversationState)
   115→
   116→    @property
   117→    def id(self) -> str:
   118→        return self.meta.id
   119→
   120→    @property
   121→    def status(self) -> ConversationStatus:
   122→        return self.meta.status
   123→
   124→    @property
   125→    def owner(self) -> str:
   126→        return self.meta.owner
   127→

1→"""
     2→Conversations API endpoints.
     3→"""
     4→from typing import Any, Optional
     5→
     6→from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request, status
     7→from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
     8→
     9→from app.agents.config import get_ai_config
    10→from app.agents.conversation import ConversationAgent
    11→from app.api.ai import EVALUATE_PROMPT
    12→from app.models.conversation import ConversationPurpose, ConversationState, ConversationStatus
    13→from app.services.conversation_service import ConversationService, ConversationNotFoundError
    14→from app.services.vector_service import VectorService
    15→from app.services.git_service import GitService
    16→from app.auth.pocketbase import get_current_user, User
    17→
    18→
    19→# Request/Response models
    20→class StartConversationRequest(BaseModel):
    21→    owner: str
    22→    purpose: Optional[str] = None
    23→    frame_id: Optional[str] = None
    24→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    25→
    26→
    27→class SendMessageRequest(BaseModel):
    28→    content: str
    29→
    30→
    31→class ConversationMessageResponse(BaseModel):
    32→    id: str
    33→    role: str
    34→    content: str
    35→    timestamp: str
    36→    metadata: Optional[dict[str, Any]] = None
    37→
    38→
    39→class ConversationStateResponse(BaseModel):
    40→    frame_type: Optional[str] = None
    41→    sections_covered: dict[str, float]
    42→    gaps: list[str]
    43→    ready_to_synthesize: bool
    44→
    45→
    46→class ConversationResponse(BaseModel):
    47→    id: str
    48→    owner: str
    49→    status: str
    50→    purpose: str = "authoring"
    51→    frame_id: Optional[str] = None
    52→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    53→    messages: list[ConversationMessageResponse]
    54→    state: ConversationStateResponse
    55→    created_at: str
    56→    updated_at: str
    57→
    58→
    59→class ConversationListItem(BaseModel):
    60→    id: str
    61→    owner: str
    62→    status: str
    63→    purpose: str = "authoring"
    64→    frame_id: Optional[str] = None
    65→    project_id: Optional[str] = None
    66→    message_count: int
    67→    updated_at: str
    68→
    69→
    70→class SendMessageResponse(BaseModel):
    71→    message: ConversationMessageResponse
    72→    ai_response: ConversationMessageResponse
    73→    state: ConversationStateResponse
    74→    relevant_knowledge: list[dict[str, Any]] = Field(default_factory=list)
    75→
    76→
    77→class PreviewResponse(BaseModel):
    78→    content: dict[str, str]
    79→
    80→
    81→class SynthesizeRequest(BaseModel):
    82→    content: Optional[dict[str, str]] = None
    83→
    84→
    85→class SynthesizeResponse(BaseModel):
    86→    frame_id: str
    87→    content: dict[str, str]
    88→
    89→
    90→def _to_conv_response(conv) -> ConversationResponse:
    91→    return ConversationResponse(
    92→        id=conv.id,
    93→        owner=conv.owner,
    94→        status=conv.status.value,
    95→        purpose=conv.meta.purpose.value,
    96→        frame_id=conv.meta.frame_id,
    97→        project_id=conv.meta.project_id,
    98→        messages=[
    99→            ConversationMessageResponse(
   100→                id=m.id,
   101→                role=m.role,
   102→                content=m.content,
   103→                timestamp=m.timestamp.isoformat(),
   104→                metadata=m.metadata,
   105→            )
   106→            for m in conv.messages
   107→        ],
   108→        state=ConversationStateResponse(
   109→            frame_type=conv.state.frame_type,
   110→            sections_covered=conv.state.sections_covered,
   111→            gaps=conv.state.gaps,
   112→            ready_to_synthesize=conv.state.ready_to_synthesize,
   113→        ),
   114→        created_at=conv.meta.created_at.isoformat(),
   115→        updated_at=conv.meta.updated_at.isoformat(),
   116→    )
   117→
   118→
   119→def get_conversation_service(request: Request) -> ConversationService:
   120→    return request.app.state.conversation_service
   121→
   122→
   123→def get_vector_service(request: Request) -> VectorService:
   124→    return request.app.state.vector_service
   125→
   126→
   127→def create_conversations_router(require_auth: bool = False) -> APIRouter:
   128→    router = APIRouter()
   129→
   130→    def get_auth_dependencies():
   131→        if require_auth:
   132→            return [Depends(get_current_user)]
   133→        return []
   134→
   135→    @router.post("", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED, dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   136→    def start_conversation(
   137→        request: StartConversationRequest,
   138→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   139→    ) -> ConversationResponse:
   140→        purpose = ConversationPurpose(request.purpose) if request.purpose else None
   141→        conv = conv_service.create_conversation(
   142→            owner=request.owner,
   143→            purpose=purpose,
   144→            frame_id=request.frame_id,
   145→            project_id=request.project_id,
   146→        )
   147→        return _to_conv_response(conv)
   148→
   149→    @router.get("")
   150→    def list_conversations(
   151→        owner: Optional[str] = None,
   152→        conv_status: Optional[str] = None,
   153→        frame_id: Optional[str] = None,
   154→        project_id: Optional[str] = None,
   155→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   156→    ) -> list[ConversationListItem]:
   157→        status_filter = ConversationStatus(conv_status) if conv_status else None
   158→        conversations = conv_service.list_conversations(
   159→            owner=owner, status=status_filter, frame_id=frame_id, project_id=project_id,
   160→        )
   161→        return [
   162→            ConversationListItem(
   163→                id=c.id,
   164→                owner=c.owner,
   165→                status=c.status.value,
   166→                purpose=c.meta.purpose.value,
   167→                frame_id=c.meta.frame_id,
   168→                project_id=c.meta.project_id,
   169→                message_count=len(c.messages),
   170→                updated_at=c.meta.updated_at.isoformat(),
   171→            )
   172→            for c in conversations
   173→        ]
   174→
   175→    @router.get("/{conv_id}")
   176→    def get_conversation(
   177→        conv_id: str,
   178→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   179→    ) -> ConversationResponse:
   180→        try:
   181→            conv = conv_service.get_conversation(conv_id)
   182→            return _to_conv_response(conv)
   183→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   184→            raise HTTPException(
   185→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   186→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   187→            )
   188→
   189→    @router.post("/{conv_id}/message", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   190→    async def send_message(
   191→        conv_id: str,
   192→        request: SendMessageRequest,
   193→        http_request: Request = None,
   194→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   195→        vector_service: VectorService = Depends(get_vector_service),
   196→    ) -> SendMessageResponse:
   197→        try:
   198→            conv = conv_service.get_conversation(conv_id)
   199→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   200→            raise HTTPException(
   201→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   202→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   203→            )
   204→
   205→        # Auto-reactivate synthesized conversations when user sends a new message
   206→        if conv.status == ConversationStatus.SYNTHESIZED:
   207→            conv_service.update_status(conv_id, ConversationStatus.ACTIVE)
   208→            conv.meta.status = ConversationStatus.ACTIVE
   209→        elif conv.status != ConversationStatus.ACTIVE:
   210→            raise HTTPException(
   211→                status_code=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
   212→                detail="Conversation is not active",
   213→            )
   214→
   215→        # Search for relevant knowledge
   216→        knowledge_context = ""
   217→        relevant_knowledge: list[dict] = []
   218→        try:
   219→            results = vector_service.search(request.content, "knowledge", limit=3)
   220→            if results:
   221→                relevant_knowledge = results
   222→                knowledge_context = "\n".join(
   223→                    f"- {r.get('content', '')}" for r in results
   224→                )
   225→        except Exception:
   226→            pass
   227→
   228→        # Call AI agent BEFORE saving messages (so failed AI calls don't corrupt conversation)
   229→        config = get_ai_config()
   230→        agent = ConversationAgent(config=config)
   231→
   232→        try:
   233→            if conv.meta.purpose == ConversationPurpose.REVIEW and conv.meta.frame_id:
   234→                # Load frame content for review context
   235→                frame_service = http_request.app.state.frame_service
   236→                try:
   237→                    frame = frame_service.get_frame(conv.meta.frame_id)
   238→                    frame_content = (
   239→                        f"## Problem Statement\n{frame.content.problem_statement or ''}\n\n"
   240→                        f"## User Perspective\n{frame.content.user_perspective or ''}\n\n"
   241→                        f"## Engineering Framing\n{frame.content.engineering_framing or ''}\n\n"
   242→                        f"## Validation Thinking\n{frame.content.validation_thinking or ''}"
   243→                    )
   244→                except Exception:
   245→                    frame_content = "(Frame content unavailable)"
   246→
   247→                turn = await agent.process_review_turn(
   248→                    messages=conv.messages,
   249→                    state=conv.state,
   250→                    user_message=request.content,
   251→                    frame_content=frame_content,
   252→                )
   253→            else:
   254→                turn = await agent.process_turn(
   255→                    messages=conv.messages,
   256→                    state=conv.state,
   257→                    user_message=request.content,
   258→                    knowledge_context=knowledge_context,
   259→                )
   260→        except Exception as e:
   261→            import logging
   262→            logging.getLogger("conversations_api").exception(f"AI call failed: {type(e).__name__}: {e}")
   263→            raise HTTPException(
   264→                status_code=status.HTTP_502_BAD_GATEWAY,
   265→                detail=f"AI service error: {str(e)}",
   266→            )
   267→
   268→        # Save user message and AI response only after successful AI call
   269→        user_msg = conv_service.add_message(conv_id, "user", request.content)
   270→        ai_msg = conv_service.add_message(conv_id, "assistant", turn.response)
   271→
   272→        # Update state
   273→        conv_service.update_state(conv_id, turn.updated_state)
   274→
   275→        return SendMessageResponse(
   276→            message=ConversationMessageResponse(
   277→                id=user_msg.id,
   278→                role=user_msg.role,
   279→                content=user_msg.content,
   280→                timestamp=user_msg.timestamp.isoformat(),
   281→                metadata=user_msg.metadata,
   282→            ),
   283→            ai_response=ConversationMessageResponse(
   284→                id=ai_msg.id,
   285→                role=ai_msg.role,
   286→                content=ai_msg.content,
   287→                timestamp=ai_msg.timestamp.isoformat(),
   288→                metadata=ai_msg.metadata,
   289→            ),
   290→            state=ConversationStateResponse(
   291→                frame_type=turn.updated_state.frame_type,
   292→                sections_covered=turn.updated_state.sections_covered,
   293→                gaps=turn.updated_state.gaps,
   294→                ready_to_synthesize=turn.updated_state.ready_to_synthesize,
   295→            ),
   296→            relevant_knowledge=relevant_knowledge,
   297→        )
   298→
   299→    @router.post("/{conv_id}/preview", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   300→    async def preview_frame(
   301→        conv_id: str,
   302→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   303→    ) -> PreviewResponse:
   304→        try:
   305→            conv = conv_service.get_conversation(conv_id)
   306→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   307→            raise HTTPException(
   308→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   309→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   310→            )
   311→
   312→        if conv.status not in (ConversationStatus.ACTIVE, ConversationStatus.SYNTHESIZED):
   313→            raise HTTPException(
   314→                status_code=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
   315→                detail="Conversation is not active",
   316→            )
   317→
   318→        config = get_ai_config()
   319→        agent = ConversationAgent(config=config)
   320→        try:
   321→            content = await agent.synthesize_frame(conv.messages, conv.state)
   322→        except Exception as e:
   323→            import logging
   324→            logging.getLogger("conversations_api").exception(f"Preview AI call failed: {type(e).__name__}: {e}")
   325→            raise HTTPException(
   326→                status_code=status.HTTP_502_BAD_GATEWAY,
   327→                detail=f"AI service error: {str(e)}",
   328→            )
   329→
   330→        return PreviewResponse(content=content)
   331→
   332→    @router.post("/{conv_id}/synthesize", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   333→    async def synthesize_frame(
   334→        conv_id: str,
   335→        request: SynthesizeRequest = SynthesizeRequest(),
   336→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   337→        http_request: Request = None,
   338→    ) -> SynthesizeResponse:
   339→        try:
   340→            conv = conv_service.get_conversation(conv_id)
   341→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   342→            raise HTTPException(
   343→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   344→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   345→            )
   346→
   347→        if conv.status not in (ConversationStatus.ACTIVE, ConversationStatus.SYNTHESIZED):
   348→            raise HTTPException(
   349→                status_code=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
   350→                detail="Conversation is not active",
   351→            )
   352→
   353→        config = get_ai_config()
   354→
   355→        # Use pre-computed content from preview if provided, otherwise call AI
   356→        if request.content:
   357→            content = request.content
   358→        else:
   359→            agent = ConversationAgent(config=config)
   360→            content = await agent.synthesize_frame(conv.messages, conv.state)
   361→
   362→        from app.models.frame import FrameContent, FrameType
   363→
   364→        frame_type_str = conv.state.frame_type or "feature"
   365→        frame_type = FrameType(frame_type_str)
   366→
   367→        frame_service = http_request.app.state.frame_service
   368→        frame_content = FrameContent(
   369→            problem_statement=content.get("problem_statement", ""),
   370→            user_perspective=content.get("user_perspective", ""),
   371→            engineering_framing=content.get("engineering_framing", ""),
   372→            validation_thinking=content.get("validation_thinking", ""),
   373→        )
   374→
   375→        # If already synthesized with a linked frame, update existing frame
   376→        existing_frame_id = conv.meta.frame_id
   377→        if existing_frame_id:
   378→            try:
   379→                frame = frame_service.update_frame_content(existing_frame_id, frame_content)
   380→            except Exception:
   381→                # Frame may have been deleted; create a new one
   382→                frame = frame_service.create_frame(
   383→                    frame_type=frame_type,
   384→                    owner=conv.owner,
   385→                    content=frame_content,
   386→                    project_id=conv.meta.project_id,
   387→                )
   388→                conv_service.link_frame(conv_id, frame.id)
   389→        else:
   390→            frame = frame_service.create_frame(
   391→                frame_type=frame_type,
   392→                owner=conv.owner,
   393→                content=frame_content,
   394→                project_id=conv.meta.project_id,
   395→            )
   396→            conv_service.link_frame(conv_id, frame.id)
   397→
   398→        # Git commit the frame changes for version history
   399→        try:
   400→            git_service: GitService = http_request.app.state.git_service
   401→            is_update = existing_frame_id is not None
   402→            git_service.commit_frame_changes(
   403→                frame_id=frame.id,
   404→                message=f"{'Re-synthesize' if is_update else 'Synthesize'} frame from conversation",
   405→                author_name=conv.owner or "system",
   406→                author_email=f"{conv.owner or 'system'}@framer",
   407→            )
   408→        except Exception:
   409→            pass
   410→
   411→        # Mark as synthesized
   412→        conv_service.update_status(conv_id, ConversationStatus.SYNTHESIZED)
   413→
   414→        # Store frame embedding for future searches
   415→        try:
   416→            vector_service = http_request.app.state.vector_service
   417→            frame_text = f"{content.get('problem_statement', '')} {content.get('user_perspective', '')} {content.get('engineering_framing', '')} {content.get('validation_thinking', '')}"
   418→            vector_service.store_embedding(
   419→                id=frame.id,
   420→                collection="frames",
   421→                content=frame_text,
   422→                metadata={"type": frame_type_str, "owner": conv.owner},
   423→            )
   424→        except Exception:
   425→            pass
   426→
   427→        # Auto-evaluate the synthesized frame using the EvaluatorAgent
   428→        # so the frame page shows a quality score immediately
   429→        try:
   430→            from app.agents.evaluator import EvaluatorAgent
   431→            evaluator = EvaluatorAgent(prompt_template=EVALUATE_PROMPT, config=config)
   432→            eval_content = (
   433→                f"# Problem Statement\n{content.get('problem_statement', '')}\n\n"
   434→                f"## User Perspective\n{content.get('user_perspective', '')}\n\n"
   435→                f"## Engineering Framing\n{content.get('engineering_framing', '')}\n\n"
   436→                f"## Validation Thinking\n{content.get('validation_thinking', '')}\n"
   437→            )
   438→            eval_result = await evaluator.evaluate(frame_content=eval_content)
   439→            frame_service.save_evaluation(
   440→                frame_id=frame.id,
   441→                score=eval_result["score"],
   442→                breakdown=eval_result["breakdown"],
   443→                feedback=eval_result["feedback"],
   444→                issues=eval_result["issues"],
   445→            )
   446→        except Exception:
   447→            import logging
   448→            logging.getLogger("conversations_api").warning(
   449→                "Auto-evaluation after synthesis failed for frame %s", frame.id, exc_info=True
   450→            )
   451→
   452→        return SynthesizeResponse(
   453→            frame_id=frame.id,
   454→            content=content,
   455→        )
   456→
   457→    @router.post("/{conv_id}/summarize-review", dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   458→    async def summarize_review(
   459→        conv_id: str,
   460→        http_request: Request = None,
   461→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   462→    ):
   463→        try:
   464→            conv = conv_service.get_conversation(conv_id)
   465→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   466→            raise HTTPException(
   467→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   468→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   469→            )
   470→
   471→        if conv.meta.purpose != ConversationPurpose.REVIEW:
   472→            raise HTTPException(
   473→                status_code=status.HTTP_400_BAD_REQUEST,
   474→                detail="Only review conversations can be summarized",
   475→            )
   476→
   477→        config = get_ai_config()
   478→        agent = ConversationAgent(config=config)
   479→
   480→        try:
   481→            result = await agent.summarize_review(conv.messages)
   482→        except Exception as e:
   483→            raise HTTPException(
   484→                status_code=status.HTTP_502_BAD_GATEWAY,
   485→                detail=f"AI service error: {str(e)}",
   486→            )
   487→
   488→        # Save review summary to frame
   489→        if conv.meta.frame_id and http_request:
   490→            try:
   491→                frame_service = http_request.app.state.frame_service
   492→                frame_service.save_review_summary(
   493→                    frame_id=conv.meta.frame_id,
   494→                    summary=result.get("summary", ""),
   495→                    comments=result.get("comments", []),
   496→                    recommendation=result.get("recommendation", "revise"),
   497→                )
   498→            except Exception:
   499→                pass
   500→
   501→        return result
   502→
   503→    @router.delete("/{conv_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT, dependencies=get_auth_dependencies())
   504→    def delete_conversation(
   505→        conv_id: str,
   506→        conv_service: ConversationService = Depends(get_conversation_service),
   507→    ):
   508→        try:
   509→            conv_service.delete_conversation(conv_id)
   510→        except ConversationNotFoundError:
   511→            raise HTTPException(
   512→                status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
   513→                detail=f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}",
   514→            )
   515→
   516→    return router
   517→

Read the actual code files thoroughly to trace the data flow from auth → message send → message display.

1→"""
     2→Conversation Service for file-based conversation operations.
     3→
     4→Follows the same pattern as FrameService: one directory per conversation.
     5→Storage: /data/conversations/conv-{id}/ with meta.yaml + messages.json + state.json
     6→"""
     7→import json
     8→import shutil
     9→import uuid
    10→from datetime import datetime, timezone
    11→from pathlib import Path
    12→from typing import Optional
    13→
    14→from app.models.conversation import (
    15→    Conversation,
    16→    ConversationMeta,
    17→    ConversationMessage,
    18→    ConversationPurpose,
    19→    ConversationState,
    20→    ConversationStatus,
    21→)
    22→
    23→
    24→class ConversationNotFoundError(Exception):
    25→    pass
    26→
    27→
    28→class ConversationService:
    29→    """Service for managing conversations via file system."""
    30→
    31→    def __init__(self, data_path: Path):
    32→        self.data_path = Path(data_path)
    33→        self.conversations_path = self.data_path / "conversations"
    34→
    35→    def _generate_id(self) -> str:
    36→        date_str = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    37→        unique_suffix = uuid.uuid4().hex[:6]
    38→        return f"conv-{date_str}-{unique_suffix}"
    39→
    40→    def _get_conv_dir(self, conv_id: str) -> Path:
    41→        return self.conversations_path / conv_id
    42→
    43→    def _read_messages(self, conv_dir: Path) -> list[ConversationMessage]:
    44→        messages_file = conv_dir / "messages.json"
    45→        if not messages_file.exists():
    46→            return []
    47→        data = json.loads(messages_file.read_text())
    48→        return [
    49→            ConversationMessage(
    50→                id=m["id"],
    51→                role=m["role"],
    52→                content=m["content"],
    53→                timestamp=datetime.fromisoformat(m["timestamp"]) if "timestamp" in m else datetime.now(timezone.utc),
    54→                metadata=m.get("metadata"),
    55→            )
    56→            for m in data.get("messages", [])
    57→        ]
    58→
    59→    def _write_messages(self, conv_dir: Path, messages: list[ConversationMessage]) -> None:
    60→        messages_file = conv_dir / "messages.json"
    61→        data = {
    62→            "messages": [
    63→                {
    64→                    "id": m.id,
    65→                    "role": m.role,
    66→                    "content": m.content,
    67→                    "timestamp": m.timestamp.isoformat(),
    68→                    "metadata": m.metadata,
    69→                }
    70→                for m in messages
    71→            ]
    72→        }
    73→        messages_file.write_text(json.dumps(data, indent=2))
    74→
    75→    def _read_state(self, conv_dir: Path) -> ConversationState:
    76→        state_file = conv_dir / "state.json"
    77→        if not state_file.exists():
    78→            return ConversationState()
    79→        data = json.loads(state_file.read_text())
    80→        return ConversationState(**data)
    81→
    82→    def _write_state(self, conv_dir: Path, state: ConversationState) -> None:
    83→        state_file = conv_dir / "state.json"
    84→        state_file.write_text(json.dumps(state.model_dump(), indent=2))
    85→
    86→    def create_conversation(
    87→        self,
    88→        owner: str,
    89→        purpose: Optional[ConversationPurpose] = None,
    90→        frame_id: Optional[str] = None,
    91→        project_id: Optional[str] = None,
    92→    ) -> Conversation:
    93→        conv_id = self._generate_id()
    94→        conv_dir = self._get_conv_dir(conv_id)
    95→        conv_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    96→
    97→        meta = ConversationMeta(
    98→            id=conv_id,
    99→            owner=owner,
   100→            purpose=purpose or ConversationPurpose.AUTHORING,

100→            purpose=purpose or ConversationPurpose.AUTHORING,
   101→            frame_id=frame_id,
   102→            project_id=project_id,
   103→        )
   104→        state = ConversationState()
   105→
   106→        (conv_dir / "meta.yaml").write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   107→        self._write_messages(conv_dir, [])
   108→        self._write_state(conv_dir, state)
   109→
   110→        return Conversation(meta=meta, messages=[], state=state)
   111→
   112→    def get_conversation(self, conv_id: str) -> Conversation:
   113→        conv_dir = self._get_conv_dir(conv_id)
   114→        if not conv_dir.exists():
   115→            raise ConversationNotFoundError(f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}")
   116→
   117→        meta = ConversationMeta.from_yaml((conv_dir / "meta.yaml").read_text())
   118→        messages = self._read_messages(conv_dir)
   119→        state = self._read_state(conv_dir)
   120→
   121→        return Conversation(meta=meta, messages=messages, state=state)
   122→
   123→    def list_conversations(
   124→        self,
   125→        owner: Optional[str] = None,
   126→        status: Optional[ConversationStatus] = None,
   127→        frame_id: Optional[str] = None,
   128→        project_id: Optional[str] = None,
   129→    ) -> list[Conversation]:
   130→        conversations = []
   131→        if not self.conversations_path.exists():
   132→            return conversations
   133→
   134→        for conv_dir in self.conversations_path.iterdir():
   135→            if conv_dir.is_dir() and conv_dir.name.startswith("conv-"):
   136→                try:
   137→                    conv = self.get_conversation(conv_dir.name)
   138→                    if owner and conv.owner != owner:
   139→                        continue
   140→                    if status and conv.status != status:
   141→                        continue
   142→                    if frame_id and conv.meta.frame_id != frame_id:
   143→                        continue
   144→                    if project_id is not None and conv.meta.project_id != project_id:
   145→                        continue
   146→                    conversations.append(conv)
   147→                except Exception:
   148→                    pass
   149→
   150→        return conversations
   151→
   152→    def add_message(
   153→        self, conv_id: str, role: str, content: str, metadata: Optional[dict] = None
   154→    ) -> ConversationMessage:
   155→        conv_dir = self._get_conv_dir(conv_id)
   156→        if not conv_dir.exists():
   157→            raise ConversationNotFoundError(f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}")
   158→
   159→        messages = self._read_messages(conv_dir)
   160→        msg_id = f"msg-{len(messages) + 1:03d}"
   161→        message = ConversationMessage(
   162→            id=msg_id, role=role, content=content, metadata=metadata
   163→        )
   164→        messages.append(message)
   165→        self._write_messages(conv_dir, messages)
   166→
   167→        # Update timestamp
   168→        meta = ConversationMeta.from_yaml((conv_dir / "meta.yaml").read_text())
   169→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   170→        (conv_dir / "meta.yaml").write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   171→
   172→        return message
   173→
   174→    def update_state(self, conv_id: str, state: ConversationState) -> Conversation:
   175→        conv_dir = self._get_conv_dir(conv_id)
   176→        if not conv_dir.exists():
   177→            raise ConversationNotFoundError(f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}")
   178→
   179→        self._write_state(conv_dir, state)
   180→
   181→        meta = ConversationMeta.from_yaml((conv_dir / "meta.yaml").read_text())
   182→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   183→        (conv_dir / "meta.yaml").write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   184→
   185→        messages = self._read_messages(conv_dir)
   186→        return Conversation(meta=meta, messages=messages, state=state)
   187→
   188→    def link_frame(self, conv_id: str, frame_id: str) -> Conversation:
   189→        conv_dir = self._get_conv_dir(conv_id)
   190→        if not conv_dir.exists():
   191→            raise ConversationNotFoundError(f"Conversation not found: {conv_id}")
   192→
   193→        meta = ConversationMeta.from_yaml((conv_dir / "meta.yaml").read_text())
   194→        meta.frame_id = frame_id
   195→        meta.updated_at = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
   196→        (conv_dir / "meta.yaml").write_text(meta.to_yaml())
   197→
   198→        messages = self._read_messages(conv_dir)
   199→        state = self._read_state(conv_dir)

content.content:
1→# Framer
     2→
     3→**AI-Assisted Pre-Development Thinking Framework**
     4→
     5→Framer is a structured thinking tool that helps engineering teams frame problems before writing code. It combines a conversation-first workflow with AI coaching to ensure thorough problem understanding, user perspective consideration, and validation planning.
     6→
     7→![Dashboard - Kanban Board](docs/screenshots/02-dashboard.png)
     8→
     9→## Why Framer?
    10→
    11→Before jumping into code, developers often miss crucial context:
    12→- **Who** is affected by this problem?
    13→- **What** are we explicitly *not* doing?
    14→- **How** will we know if we succeeded?
    15→
    16→Framer provides a structured framework to capture this thinking through natural conversation with an AI coach, then synthesizes it into a well-organized frame document.
    17→
    18→## Key Features
    19→
    20→### Conversation-First Frame Creation
    21→
    22→Start by describing your problem in plain language. The AI Coach guides you through structured thinking, tracking discussion coverage across four key dimensions in real time.
    23→
    24→![Conversation Interface](docs/screenshots/05-conversation.png)
    25→
    26→The right sidebar shows **Discussion Coverage** — how much of each section has been explored — along with identified gaps. When ready, preview the synthesized frame before committing.
    27→
    28→### Structured Frame Documents
    29→
    30→Each frame captures four dimensions of pre-development thinking:
    31→
    32→| Section | Purpose |
    33→|---------|---------|
    34→| **Problem Statement** | Clear, focused description of what needs solving |
    35→| **User Perspective** | Who experiences this, their journey, and pain points |
    36→| **Engineering Framing** | Technical principles, trade-offs, and explicit non-goals |
    37→| **Validation Thinking** | Success signals and disconfirming evidence |
    38→
    39→![Frame Detail View](docs/screenshots/03-frame-detail.png)
    40→
    41→### AI-Powered Quality Assessment
    42→
    43→Frames are automatically evaluated by AI for completeness and quality. The evaluation provides a score breakdown per section, written feedback, and specific issues to address.
    44→
    45→![AI Evaluation & Version History](docs/screenshots/04-ai-evaluation.png)
    46→
    47→### Kanban Workflow
    48→
    49→Visual status tracking with drag-and-drop across stages:
    50→
    51→**Draft** → **In Review** → **Ready** → **Feedback** → **Archived**
    52→
    53→Filter by frame type (Feature, Bug, Exploration) or owner. Each card shows the AI quality score at a glance.
    54→
    55→### Knowledge Base
    56→
    57→A team-wide knowledge system for patterns, decisions, and lessons learned. Supports semantic search via vector embeddings and manual categorization.
    58→
    59→![Knowledge Base](docs/screenshots/06-knowledge.png)
    60→
    61→Categories: **Pattern** | **Decision** | **Prediction** | **Context** | **Lesson**
    62→
    63→### Frame Preview
    64→
    65→Preview what a synthesized frame will look like before committing. If no new messages have been sent since the last preview, the cached content is reused — no redundant AI calls.
    66→
    67→### Version History
    68→
    69→Git-backed change tracking with full diff support. Every synthesis and edit creates a commit, so you can trace how a frame evolved over time.
    70→
    71→### Admin Portal
    72→
    73→Separate admin interface for system configuration, user management, and AI provider settings.
    74→
    75→![Admin Portal](docs/screenshots/07-admin-login.png)
    76→
    77→## Architecture
    78→
    79→```
    80→┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
    81→│                    Frontend (Next.js)                        │
    82→│  React 19 + Zustand + Tailwind CSS v4 + Radix UI           │
    83→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    84→│                    Backend (FastAPI)                         │
    85→│  REST API + AI Agents + File Storage + ChromaDB Vectors     │
    86→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    87→│                   PocketBase (Auth)                          │
    88→│  User Authentication + Session Management                   │
    89→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
    90→```
    91→
    92→### Backend Services
    93→- **FrameService**: CRUD operations with file-based storage (YAML/JSON/Markdown)
    94→- **ConversationService**: Conversation history and state management
    95→- **KnowledgeService**: Knowledge entry persistence and retrieval
    96→- **VectorService**: Semantic search via ChromaDB (default: all-MiniLM-L6-v2 embeddings)
    97→- **GitService**: Automatic version control with diff support
    98→- **IndexService**: SQLite cache for fast queries
    99→
   100→### AI Agents
   101→- **ConversationAgent**: Guides users through structured problem framing via chat
   102→- **EvaluatorAgent**: Scores frames and provides detailed quality feedback
   103→- **GeneratorAgent**: Creates content from questionnaire answers
   104→- **RefinerAgent**: Improves content through conversation
   105→
   106→AI providers are configurable — supports **Anthropic**, **OpenAI**, and any **OpenAI-compatible** endpoint (MiniMax, GLM, local models, etc.).
   107→
   108→## Getting Started
   109→
   110→### Prerequisites
   111→- Docker & Docker Compose (recommended)
   112→- Or: Python 3.12+ and Node.js 20+
   113→
   114→### Quick Start with Docker
   115→
   116→```bash
   117→# Clone the repository
   118→git clone https://github.com/ethannortharc/framer.git
   119→cd framer
   120→
   121→# Start all services
   122→docker compose up -d
   123→
   124→# Or use the helper script for specific environments
   125→./scripts/docker.sh dev up      # Development
   126→./scripts/docker.sh qa up       # QA/Staging
   127→./scripts/docker.sh prod up     # Production
   128→```
   129→
   130→Services:
   131→- Frontend: http://localhost:3000
   132→- Backend API: http://localhost:8000
   133→- PocketBase Admin: http://localhost:8090/_/
   134→
   135→### Local Development
   136→
   137→```bash
   138→# Install dependencies
   139→make install
   140→
   141→# Start development servers
   142→make dev
   143→```
   144→
   145→Or start each service individually:
   146→
   147→```bash
   148→# Terminal 1: Backend
   149→cd src/backend
   150→uvicorn app.main:get_app --reload --port 8000
   151→
   152→# Terminal 2: Frontend
   153→cd src/frontend
   154→npm run dev
   155→```
   156→
   157→## Configuration
   158→
   159→### Environment Variables
   160→
   161→Configuration files are stored in `config/` directory:
   162→- `.env.common` — Shared settings across all environments
   163→- `.env.dev` — Development (ports 3000, 8000, 8090)
   164→- `.env.qa` — QA/Staging (ports 3001, 8001, 8091)
   165→- `.env.prod` — Production (ports 80, 8000, 8090)
   166→
   167→### AI Configuration
   168→
   169→```env
   170→AI_PROVIDER=anthropic          # anthropic | openai | minimax | glm
   171→AI_API_KEY=your-api-key
   172→REDACTED
   173→AI_TEMPERATURE=0.7
   174→AI_MAX_TOKENS=4096
   175→AI_TIMEOUT=300
   176→```
   177→
   178→### Embedding Configuration
   179→
   180→```env
   181→EMBEDDING_PROVIDER=default     # default (all-MiniLM-L6-v2) | openai (text-embedding-3-small)
   182→```
   183→
   184→## Project Structure
   185→
   186→```
   187→framer/
   188→├── src/
   189→│   ├── backend/              # FastAPI backend
   190→│   │   └── app/
   191→│   │       ├── api/          # REST endpoints (frames, conversations, knowledge, ai, admin)
   192→│   │       ├── agents/       # AI agents (conversation, evaluator, generator, refiner)
   193→│   │       ├── auth/         # PocketBase authentication
   194→│   │       ├── models/       # Pydantic data models
   195→│   │       └── services/     # Business logic (frame, conversation, knowledge, git, vector)
   196→│   │
   197→│   └── frontend/             # Next.js frontend
   198→│       └── src/
   199→│           ├── app/          # App router (dashboard, new, frame/[id], knowledge, admin, archive)
   200→│           ├── components/   # React components (ui, layout, dashboard, frame, conversation)
